author: {'steamid': '76561198052033507', 'num_games_owned': 3014, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1701908547}
review:
Я поставил себе две амбициозные цели: постепенно купить все игры от издателя Devolver Digital, и пройти все игры от издателя Devolver Digital. Зачем мне всё это? Просто я обожаю игры от этого издателя. Они находят талантливых людей с безумными идеями и помогают реализовать их.

По скриншотам вообще не ясно, что это за игра. А на деле это сюжетный симулятор диджея. Нам на выбор дают инструменты, а мы с помощью 4 кнопок задаём темп. Там ещё есть потная штука с кучей кнопок, чтобы менять сам звук, но это уже слишком сложно для меня. Я же хочу поведать об игре со своей точки зрения. У меня нет музыкального слуха и я ничего не понимаю в музыке. Я просто тыкаю кнопки и из этого комбинируется мелодия. Почти всегда у меня получалась какофония, но игра всеми силами старается привести это к нормальному звучанию. После моих нелепых кликаний она всегда хвалит меня, какой я молодец, какой я оригинальный. Полученный трек можно облагородить обложкой, которую создаём мы сами с хорошим инструментарием. Даже можно сохранить на свой компьютер полученный "шедевр"! Проходится игра очень быстро и можно дальше самому побаловаться вне сюжетки. 

Сюжет же тут простенький и не нагружающий. Мы помогаем людям побороть скуку и тоску с помощью СИЛЫ МУЗЫКИ. Всего  здесь 5 уровней, каждый со своим визуалом и эффектами.

Выглядит игра, ну скажем честно, как сон наркомана. Всюду странные эффекты и персонажи. В целом же, это весело и мне понравилось.

Как вы понимаете, вся суть здесь строится на музыке. Игра пытается показать нам, что каждый может творить музыку, каким бы рукожопом он ни был. Я всё так же остался рукожопом, но мне приятно было создавать иллюзию того, что я талантливый. А если вы реально талантливые, то сможете сотворить шедевр на все времена.

В итоге хочу сказать, что игра необычная и прикольная. Стоит недорого, проходится быстро. Дарит необычный игровой опыт и поднимает настроение. Обязательно попробуйте! Devolver Digital фигни не издают, запомните это.

Плюсы:
- забавный визуал
- можно почувствовать себя талантливым диджеем
- можно сохранить свой шедевр на компьютере
- хорошая музыка
- непродолжительная
- необычный игровой опыт

author: {'steamid': '76561197970485826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1700276296}
review:
It's almost 10 years since this cute DJ Mixing Toy/game came out, and I still come back to it once a year. It's also my default "gift to everyone" Steam game, because it's so unknown yet it brings a smile to anyone who plays it.

It's just so genuinely fun, cheesy, whimsical, and simple to play that you can't help but to fall in love with it. 

I'd love to see a remaster or expansion that keeps the feel of the original but with extra levels. The design and simplicity is genius, tight fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977206728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1513473960}
review:
I freakin' love this game.  It's basically a music sequencer with a story mode attached to it and I'm all about that.  

It's short but fun, and the (admittedly limited) gameplay is pretty unique and really stands out among all the games I've played.  The songs it makes are decently interesting too, and the best part is I'd say anyone can play this and have fun, whether you already are into this kind of stuff or you're completely new to making music.

100% recommend, the only thing I'd say you should know before buying is that it's pretty short and there's no way to "lose" so it's not challenging or anything.  If you go in with the expectation that this is just a fun way to waste a few hours and make some random music while you listen to a completely over-the-top story, then I think you'll enjoy yourself and find it's well worth the three bucks you spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070089230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1642582150}
review:
So, I want to start by saying that this is not a "bad game". It's very well put together, the concept is one I find interested, and I want to give full credit where credit is due there. Props to the developer(s) for putting together more of a game than I ever have.

That said, Cosmic DJ is...lacking. As a game, well, how do you make a game that judges you on your funky beats? It's not an easy question. Cosmic DJ's solution is to just judge you on how many notes you slap down. Doesn't matter how good they sound, just slap enough down and you win. But, I mean, in a way, this isn't a "game" now is it? It's music creation software. Well, as music creation software, it's also horribly lacking. You get four notes, a two bar 4/4 loop, no note velocity or instrument volume controls, and no way of directly selecting what instruments you'd like to use in the quick play mode (or, at least, none that I can find). As a result, you're already limited in what you can make, though it should be said that the four notes and two bar loop are probably the least bad of its limitations. But, further limiting you, there's no way to directly export the loop you made short of OBS or the analog hole (or, again, not that I can find). Instead, to export, it pumps your loop into a single template (or, at least, one of a few) and that's the only way to get anything out.

In conclusion, the game side is made awkward by its success condition and as a music creation tool, it's so limited that many of you would be better off just downloading LMMS. Yeah, it's more complicated. Yeah, it's harder. But it's also far less limiting. I could see this maybe being worth it if three changes were made:
1) Add instrument volume controls at the very least, if not also rudimentary note velocity;
2) Add the ability to properly change instruments in quick play, rather than just being given random instruments; and
3) Allow directly exporting a loop.
Until then, I appreciate the concept, I respect the attempt, but I cannot recommend Cosmic DJ in good faith.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1550369491}
review:
Cosmic DJ is a very weird game where you create music to bring back the harmony in the galaxy.

Story:

You play as an unnamed person (let's pretend it's yourself). You're a cosmic DJ and STEVE3 the cosmic conductor of the universe asks for you help to repair jamtennas so you can restore the harmony of the universe. 

The story is very light, it might as well not even exist, but what writing is there is really decent and quite charming. It's a very bizarre storyline, but it works well enough considering the very trippy nature of the game, so don't expect anything deep going in and you should be good.

Graphics:

Best way to describe the art style of Cosmic DJ is imagine the most trippy music videos you've seen and imagine the backgrounds as the set up for the levels of this game. I will say that there's a lot of bright shining lights which could cause seizures so be careful.

Overall the style is decent. I liked the trippy imagery throughout the levels and the overall simplistic design of the game. It's very pleasing to the eye, but like I said it might be too much for certain people, so look up so live gameplay to see if you can handle it.

Audio:

Since this is a music based game, audio has to be top notch and it definitely is. Most of the beats are preset for you, you can just layer on top of them and you can honestly make some truly catchy tunes. The main beats are decent and allow you to truly play around on your music creation skills.

The voice acting is decent and the actor for STEVE3 does a decent job, but there's not much of it. But overall the audio design is great. The only negative is that there's not more beats to mess around with, which could have been really cool. 

Gameplay:

Cosmic DJ is not much of a game, but more or less a music software disguised as a game. It has a game like structure, where you go through levels by creating music, but you can barely call it a game. Each track you create no matter how simple will still advance you forward in the game, so it's more or less a very simplistic software for you to tinker around in.

The tools themselves are simple, you can mess around with the tempo, add instruments or beeps and other things and it's really easy to use and quickly you can make some truly catchy beats. It's honestly quite fun to mess around with and I had a blast with this one, even going back and redoing a track from the beginning because I wasn't satisfied with the first attempt of mine. You can also create album covers and export your music to share, which was a really cool little feature. 

Verdict:

Cosmic DJ is a great experimental "game". If you like music and want to mess around a software without having to learn FL Studio, then you should definitely get Cosmic DJ. It's cheap, fun and really charming so I highly suggest checking it out. 

Final Rating:
8/10
 
Pros:
+ Charming presentation
+ Really easy to use
+ You can make some beats insanely catchy

Cons:
- Not really a game
- Not many beats to mess around with

If you liked this review please consider joining https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198089049495', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1602508829}
review:
Sehr cooles Game! Aber wie n paar Leute hier schon geschrieben haben, es ist leider wirklich viel zu kurz!
In dem Spiel steckt so massiv viel Potenzial!! Gerne echt noch einen 2. Teil und n Freien Modus, bei dem man die Instrumente selbst bestimmen kann und rum probieren wie man gerade lustig is.

Geil wär natürlich auch, wenn das ganze noch ne Genreausdehnung bekommen würde im High BPM bereich oder experimentellere Genres! :-) 
Aber hey für 2.99€ kann man nich meckern, bei diesem kurzweiligen Vergnügen! <3
Kauft es euch!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035005176', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1601932145}
review:
Simple but entertaining little game. The goal is quite simple : you must fix the universe with the ''PoWeR Of MUSIC!!!!''

The way to do this is by creating simple mix with the synths they give you and try to make something nice out of it. Sometimes it works out, sometimes it doesn't, still fun either way. 

There's also a ton of random psychedelic effects and graphics, pretty charming stuff.

Finished it in about an hour and a half. Probably worth a replay (especially If you have young kids, they might find the gameplay interesting).

Overall worth a try, I like it!

Cosmic DJ is a game developed by Gl33k and published by Devolver Digital

Cosmic DJ overall, however, is a fun game to play, and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a very good casual music game and to play in short bursts

author: {'steamid': '76561197981141738', 'num_games_owned': 1191, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1600963437}
review:
You make music, the game makes it easy and clear to figure out how making music works on a step sequencer, you aren't overloaded with the sort of fine-tuning effects racks and synth parameters that might confuse and lose people who don't know much about how synth music production works.

It's basic, it's fun, and aside from the cheesy lines from the tutorial/guide voice I love everything about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134219338', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1591307906}
review: Garage Band gameified. You are given a partially composed piece of repeating electronic music and lay out rhythms on some more instruments to complete the track. The notes you put out also affect the visuals of the scene which makes a experimenting really enjoyable. At the end of a set they mix all the tracks you've made and you can download it which is a super satisfying reward if you've made your tracks sound nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054223705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1625930216}
review: A supremely weird but awesome music game experience. Great to play when you're already heavily medicated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126451883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1591094756}
review:
Cute and charming, but overall it felt kind of pointless.

The game aspect requires no real skill. Simply tap on some instruments until a bar is filled.
The music creation aspect is also far from satisfying. You're forced to lay beats over a backing track and often the sounds don't go very well together. You can choose from a "tap" interface or a sequencer, but the tap interface feels kinda unresponsive and off-time (especially when working with percussion).

It's a bit of fun if you got it for a dollar or two, but don't expect anything too robust.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960959371', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1587782257}
review:
Cosmic DJ is a wacky, colorful, and sometimes psychedelic adventure into space to save your friends using a 4 key sequencer to make electronic dance music. The UI is simple and intuitive; it makes it pretty easy to make a song that sounds pretty decent. You'll know from the trailer if you're going to like the music and humor.

One of the coolest features is, after you successfully finish each level, you can export your jam as an mp3. You're hilariously given 30 seconds to draw an album cover using an MS paint-like interface, which usually results in trying to make cool looking art only to run out of time and have a laughable half-finished mess as your album cover. 

You might only get a few hours of fun out of it, but for only a few dollars, it's a great value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064388679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1563295593}
review:
At the start of each level you're presented with instrument loops encased in clickable boxes. Click them to listen then use the grid sequencer or pad to match what you heard. Repeat until all the instrument parts are matched and you've completed the level.

I didn't understand the tutorial or knew what i was doing but it sounded good so i went ahead to the gameplay. By that time i had a fairly good idea what to do. It's fun for ear and memory training. Unsure if missing the actual keys and beats to saturate your arrangement with random inputs is good enough to progress but it sure didn't sound bad

[b]8/10[/b] Loads of fun, easy UI and interesting sounds. No lags on my potato laptop.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961734538', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1553925938}
review:
Cosmic DJ is a pretty fun little game. It's basically a gamified version of the tools used to make electronic music - a Guitar Hero for ravers. The visuals are a delightful mashup of 80s CGI and more modern voxel stuff like Minecraft. The voice acting is cheerful and the story is completely silly. It feels like the Frankie Goes To Hollywood computer game. Cosmic DJ is 100% good vibes, man. It will definitely put a smile on your face.

The one complaint i have about the game is that you are railroaded into making a very busy arrangement. You "win" each round by adding more and more notes, but usually by the time you get to the end it's too dense for my tastes, and you skipped through far catchier grooves when you only had one or two instruments going. Obviously the game makes sure that no matter what notes you choose it will sound "good", so there isn't much freedom to choose dissonant notes or build a totally wonky rhythm, but I think it would have been better if the arrangements were more sparse to begin with, so there was more sense of building your own groove. As it is, you might as well embrace the trance of it all and pull out three-note bass lines and layer supersaws like you're Tiësto.

Still, there is no time pressure, and not really any reason to try "win" a level, so if you do just want to mess around with some fun little instruments and build minimal loops, you can do that. I think Beat The Game took this idea in a more interesting direction by giving you slightly sparser arrangements and having more nods to real-world synthesizers and the outdoor rave scene, but Cosmic DJ is still a fun diversion if you are into synths or electronic music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062301817', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1695520516}
review:
It's mostly a simple tool for sequencing music. With its simplicity comes a lot of limitations (you don't get to choose your instruments, they're randomly assigned; you can only place sixteenth notes; the loops last two bars, nothing more; you can have up to 4 instruments in a track), which can feel boring after a while, but it's also part of why it's easy to pick up. Its minimalism is also part of its beauty in my opinion, as you get to try your best with the instruments you get and with the constraints you have. 

The game also has one of the weirdest stories you'll ever see, in which you solve all of the problems with the POWER OF MUSIC. The narration is funny, and the whole thing doesn't make much sense, but in a way that'll keep you hooked. It's also impossible to fail a level; as long as you put at least a certain number of notes, you succeed and you get to the next song as soon as you're ready. There's not really a point to it and absolutely no challenge whatsoever, so I can get why someone wouldn't see the appeal in it, but in my opinion that makes the game even better. Sorry for the generic adjectives, but it's super experimental, it's oddly charming and it's unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197768', 'num_games_owned': 3607, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1684666574}
review:
Cosmic DJ est un jeu atypique car il est à la fois un logiciel de musique et un jeu sans challenge particulier hormis celui d'établir une séquence à partir des instruments fournis.

Autant le dire, il n'y a pas d'histoire et c'est un délire sous acide qui nous est proposé là. Le mode narration dure environ une petite heure voire moins et c'est un déluge de wtf que l'on visionne. Pour ma part, j'ai adoré.

Quand au mode création, ce n'est pas un logiciel musical à proprement parlé et croire que l'on fait tout ce que l'on veut avec serait complétement hors du sujet. Mais le délire visuel, si on accroche à cela, rejoint celui des samples et si on veut bien "entrer" dans le jeu, on s'amuse bien et on devient un "cosmic dj"

Alors oui, il ne dure pas longtemps, oui il n'y a ni challenge ardu, ni creation musicale. Mais c'est du pur délire et rien que pour cela il est unique et vaut vraiment la peine de s'y attarder quelques minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078048130', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1531404849}
review:
[h1]THE POWER OF MUSIC![/h1]


코즈믹 쨈을 이용해 혼돈에 빠진 우주를 비트로 정리하는 게임입니다.

듣다보면 고개가 절로 끄덕여지는 일렉트로닉 비트에 조금 과장을 보태서 살바도르 달리가 떠오를 만한 초현실주의적인 배경을 놓고 플레이 하다보면 여느세 흥이 돋아나더군요.

단순하게 Z,X,C,V 이 4가지 키를 가지고 주어진 비트에 맞춰 여러가지 효과음 내지 악기들을 연주하며 플레이 하는데, 조금 더 세밀하게 컨트롤 할 수 있게끔 직사각형의 런치패드처럼 생긴 화면상의 패드으로도 박자나 음 높이를 조절 할 수 있어 좋았습니다.


그러나 나름 필요한 사양도 그리 높진 않아서 저사양 컴퓨터로도 무리 없이 돌리실 수 있으나 각 챕터가 끝나고 앨범을 만들 때마다 전부 렉이 걸리다 튕기더군요...

공식 한글화 또한 지원하지 않지만 해석하긴 어렵지 않아 스토리 모드도 무리없이 진행하실 수 있을겁니다.


그저 게임 플레이를 한마디로 요약하자면 "[b]Wii music[/b] 과 [b]incredibox[/b]가 적절하게 섞인 플레이"이라고 할 수 있을거 같습니다..


이상으로 정가주고 하긴 비싸고 할인 가격 주고 하면 충분히 저렴한 [h1]Cosmic DJ[/h1]였습니다.

review: i was hoping this would be a less annoying game than it was. the levels were kind of funny i guess. this would be amazing for amall child, of which i am not, so i did not care for it. the most fun part, however, was being able to create the album art and see the small stories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984165726', 'num_games_owned': 1229, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1529857090}
review:
Ok, let's review this indie thing.
Fun? Yeah.
Good? eeeeeeh.
Worth? Well it's about $3.00 so you kinda get what you pay for really. 

Pros: Fun, catchy tunes that make you wanna snap your finger, tap your foot and bob your head with. You can also save an 80 sec. remix of your song to listen to and share with friends. 

Cons: it's extremely short with about 6 stages total if you include the tutorial and final boss, but for $3.00 i can't really complain. Very limited to what you can do in "quick play" mode as you can't choose your own instruments but instead use a random selection.

I enjoyed the game but once you've played through it your milage may vary when it comes to replay-ability. One of those "pick up and play, then probably never touch it again" types. At first glance it looked like a "DJ Hero" cloan but to my pleasent surprise it was a bit more "freestyle" than that. it's just a shame that it was so short.

I'd give it a 7 out of 10. Not amazing but still well above average. But can I recommend it?
eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeh.....it's $3.00. If you want to get a good hour or two of random musical entertainment, go for it.

review:
So I wasn't sure what to expect from this game. But I already got a couple back together and DJ'd at their wedding with the power of music. I then saved and exported my music mix and jammed to my love conquers mix in .mp3 format. I even did some cover art. All in under 15 minutes.

I got this game on a Steam sale for .74 cents. I already got more than my money's worth. Don't worry, I won't let my newfound fame and glory get to my head. But you can check out my album drop soon. See below for a teaser.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1403993316

author: {'steamid': '76561198057247401', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1601072708}
review:
No tiene logros. No tiene cromos. Pero si alguna vez trataste de ser o fuiste DJ, y te gustaba tirar mixes... TENES QUE PROBAR ESTE JUEGO.
No solo que tenes una historia en la cual tenes que usar el POWEEERR OFFF MUSIICC si no que exportas tus canciones a MP3. WHAAAATTTSSS?
Los samples estan geniales, y me hace acordar a esos soft medios nabos de mezclas, nada mas que en este no te sentis tan nabo (o mas nabo) por que es un juego y "cheee estoy jugando", pero experimentar con los sonidos, la musica, las bases como en este juego, es una gran cosa.

Estoy muy contento con esta adquisicion, y mas de una vez, jugando, me pesque con mi propia cancion moviendo la cabeza... o cuando logras una combinacion grosa, me encontre levantando el brazo como si estuviese enfrente a una multitud.

Voy a tirar alguna contra para que no sea todo color de rosas: te exporta mp3 de 1.26 minutos solamente, de la cancion que se le antoja del set de 3 o 4 que te toca (al menos hasta donde jugue, si cambia a medida del avance, edito), y las "tapas" de los "discos" que haces, son una porqueria. 

Por el precio que tiene, y mas si lo agarras en oferta como yo (7 mangos lo garpe), no tiene ningun desperdicio.

POWER OF MUSIC.

edit: no, no cambia. Es mas, ya lo termine jaja. Pero es muy rejugable. Lamentablemente, no podes elegir instrumentos y mixear, si no que vas poniendo nuevos instrumentos y el juego te arma los kits porque si. Una lastima, pero de todas maneras muy rejugable en quick mode para tirar unos sets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110844057', 'num_games_owned': 877, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1511386226}
review:
[b]wholesome /ˈhəʊls(ə)m/[/b]
[i]conducive to or suggestive of good health and physical well-being[/i]


Video games have grown to be associated with gore, violence and disturbing content en masse with their exposure in mass media. While game series like [i]Gears of War[/i] and [i]Grand Theft Auto[/i] are frequent in best-sellers chart tops, they are adored for and defined by their gameplay and effort put into them, not by the quantity of blood one can spill.  This is further proved when projects like the recent [i]Super Mario Odyssey[/i] appear alongside them, at first glance a complete opposite of what a stereotypical gamer would expect, but it is the dedication and nurturing love that developers put into their work that helps shape success for these titles. [i]Cosmic DJ[/i] is no exception to the rule.


[h1][b]The Atmosphere[/b][/h1]

From the divine and praising chorus singing your title of "cosmic DJ" upon booting up the game to the encouraging spirit of music that accompanies you in your journey, all the aspects of the game revolve around the term "wholesome". Your presence in the game is valued and the significance of your actions to the events highlighted, which makes for a truly heartwarming experience, one that leaves you with desire to return to the game no matter what.


[h1][b]The Gameplay[/b][/h1]

Despite being a desktop PC game, [i]Cosmic DJ[/i] feels a lot like an app designed for mobile platforms: it takes up an insignificant volume of space on your hard drive, has lightning-fast loading speed, catchy neon graphics and the "pick-up-and-play" nature where you can start playing it in summer, then come back during winter and still be able to have fun without the daunting necessity of having to recomplete tutorial sections. All these factors combined help the title stay relevant and engaging with little input from the developers once it is released - a welcome decision, in my eyes.

The gameplay itself revolves around making repeated rhythmic beats using either the Z, X, C and V keys on your keyboard to "drum" the notes in or a sequencer, should you wish for more accuracy when editing your tracks. The goal of each stage is to fill up the "excitement gauge" and, consequentially, cheer up whatever crowd is listening to you. In the grand scheme of things, these actions help you reunite an old band that fell apart shortly before the events of the game, as well as repair "jamtennas" - satellites that broadcast jams to the people. Overall, the experience can be best described as relaxing, with soothing sounds and energetic beats to choose from when creating your next best hit, which can be exported as an .mp3 file, should you need to save it for later!


[h1][b]The Conclusion[/b][/h1]

[i]Cosmic DJ[/i] is one of the shamefully overlooked "hidden gems" of the Steam library. With its low price and nurturing attitude towards the player, the game deserves at least a partial playthrough, because we all need that "pick-me-up" game at the end of a hard day.

[i]This game has been nominated for "The World Is Grim Enough Let's Just All Get Along” Award of Steam Awards 2017[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044544929', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1469462577}
review:
Short, indescribable, lush, empowering, lovely.

If you understand why random llamas, double rainbows and laser eyed kittens all dancing to a hot jam mix you create in realtime is an experience worth savouring, dive in.

It is smol/short, with little hope of expansion or modding but it also saves to disk whatever psychedelic semi-autonomous musical doolings you co-create, which you can upload for posterity, and for the price of a coffee or cheeseburger it is hardly fair to complain that it only lasted a few hours.

If you end up not just mclovin it but craving more, search out the Digital Dynamite coalition online. Their free apps such as "Wir Sind Einstein" are non-interactive but on a level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103515936', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1450320569}
review:
Hermoso juego, creativo y con gran contenido para lo que es...
... el juego tiene dos formas de crear musica de forma muy facil e intuitiva. El juego se aprovecha en 2hrs quedando corto a la hora de seguir aprovechandolo.

Las visuales y los contenidos sonoros son muy buenos, pero al terminarlo te quedas con ganas de mas.

Sería un gran juego si tuviera mas libertad de edición, considero que el juego en si, tal como esta como si fuera el primer nivel de un juego con 10 niveles mas.

Para pasar un rato lucido, dejandote llevar por las visuales y la musica... pero luego, quedará en tu biblioteca para siempre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055717536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1524632776}
review:
[b]POWER OF MUSIC 感じるんでしたよね？[/b]


何もかもが一発キメてんじゃねーかというような世界観でピコピコと音を奏でるゲーム。頭がヤバくない要素を見つけるほうが難しい。やってるとこっちまでアヤシイ感じになる

「音楽を作る」というより「いじってみる」といった趣のゲームで、もともと音楽的素養とか経験がある人がきちんと作って遊ぼうとすると不自由な面や縛られる部分が多いと思う
小中学校の音楽の授業で意味不明な譜面を作っていた、センスが全面的に壊滅しているタイプの人の方が楽しめるかも

聞ける音楽として完成させるには多少、試行錯誤する必要があるが、気に入ったフレーズができれば後は勝手に自動でやってくれる。なんかコレいいじゃん？で一曲出来てしまうのが心地よい。簡易ながらアルバムのアートワークも作れます
セールのときに何かのついでに買ったりフレンドに送りつけるにはいいゲーム

Don't think. Feel POWER OF MUSIC.(ガンギマリ)

author: {'steamid': '76561198157350260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1550411847}
review: Comprei o Cosmic DJ e curti bastante. Porém, quero dar uma resalva. Na parte de produzir a música. Poderia ser inserido também uma forma da pessoa escolher os instrumentos que pessoa deseja usar. Desta forma seria ainda mais foda. Sinceramente. Pois, na hora de produzir a mesma os instrumentos vem no modo aleatório na sorte. Como disse antes seria mais show podermos escolher. Portanto minha nota para ele e 8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199639406', 'num_games_owned': 1470, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1495179963}
review:
Херня, если честно. 
Сами звуки (музыка) напоминает первые электронные группы, но сейчас не 1970 год. Да, нужно жать всего одну кнопку, геймплей до ужаса скучен именно из-за этого. В плане треков - ладно бы получалось что-то слушабельное, но выходит полный неслушабельный трэш с очень резкими кислотными звуками. Такое я не стал бы слушать, даже если бы долбанул героина. И по сути, создать свой трек здесь невозможно (и не нужно) - большое ограничение во всем. Пожалуй, верну 19 рублей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1502731043}
review:
Tags: Casual - Music & Rhythm
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Barebones hotspot clicker in which you assign sound effects to a timetable while the rest of a song is digitized for you. Audiovisuals are all groovy and whatnot but the game is too thin to bother, played it through once and it was not really worth it. This has no replay value. 

Nice idea and art direction but too limited in how you can create music, too much asset recycling both for sounds and for visuals. The plot itself recycles itself as you keep hearing over and over about Jamtennas. You can just brute force a win with button mashing and the album cover art section was lazily implemented.

Conclusion: More refined mechanics and get away from tablet-oriented design philosophy next time and you might make something worth keeping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2464, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1483616424}
review:
내가 만드는 리듬 게임.

다양한 큐브가 존재하며, 이 것들이 악기+무대 효과의 역할을 합니다.
악기에는 4가지 음이 배정되어있으며, TAP에서 ZXCV의 키를 눌러서 조정하거나,
GRID에서 특정 위치에 파트를 배정하여 리듬을 제작할 수 있습니다.

플레이어가 직접 음악을 만드는 형식이기에, 게임의 클리어는 그렇게 어렵지 않습니다.
그냥 악기를 모두 사용하면 클리어하는 정도?
이 게임의 목적은 스스로 만든 음악을 즐긴다라고 보고있습니다.

하지만, 살짝 음들이 부족하고 정지하여 세부적인 설정을 하기 힘듭니다.
일부 음의 경우는 미세할 정도로 소리가 작아서 판별하기 힘든 경우도 있고,
배경음이 오히려 더 크게 느껴지는 경우도 있죠.

그렇다고 해도 나쁘진 않습니다.
플레이어가 직접 노래의 리듬을 직접 참여할 수 있기에 즐기면서 만들 수 있고,
그렇게 제작된 앨범의 표지도 제작할 수 있죠. 시간 제한이 있지만.

não apresenta dificuldades tecnicas... é bem intuitivo

O maior problema na minha opinião é que o jogo dura 40 minutos... sim você demora isso pra acaba a história do jogo.

Se tu quer história ou mais tempo de jogo.. é.. não... melhor procurar outro jogo..

author: {'steamid': '76561198141519076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1534019237}
review: Jam'ler, biraz daha fazla jam'ler, daha çok jam'lar, aksiyon, macera, aşk, arkadaşlık, ve ekip çalışması. Her şey oyunlar için müzikler yapan müzik yapımıcısı Gl33k'ın "Lan o kadar oyuna müzik yapıyoruz, kendimiz bir oyun yapamıyoruz." demesiyle başlamış, yanına birkaç adam alıp "Haydi oyun yapalım!" gazıyla yapılmış, en nihayetinde en iyi yaptığı şey olan müziğini ortaya koyarak hazırladığı bu oyunda aksiyonu da, macerayı da, aşkı da, arkadaşlığı da, ekip çalışmasını da müzik ile yaşıyoruz. Yani ön planda her daim müzik var. Aksiyonu bile müzik yaparak yaşıyoruz. Anlayacağınız hayatımız olmuş müzik. Oyun, eğitim bölümü dışında 5 bölümden oluşuyor. İlk 4 bölümde Steve4 isimli anne gazıyla şarkı alıcılarını bozup kendi kötü şarkılarını insanlara dinletmeye başlamasıyla başlıyor ve biz de araları bozulan arkadaşları, ekipleri, sevgilileri ve hatta parçalara ayrılan bir köpeği topluyoruz ve bozulan alıcıları tamir ettiriyoruz. Tabi bunu müzik yaparak yapıyoruz. Boss fight'da aynı şekilde. Anlayacağınız oyun müzikten ibaret ama çok tatlı da bir hikayesi de var (tam hikaye de denemez aslında). Tabi oyunun asıl amacı müzik olduğu için böyle bir hikaye modu bile böyle bir oyun için muhteşem bir özellik olmuş. E peki hikaye modu bitince ne yapacağız? Burada da oyunun merkezi olan Quick Play özelliği devreye giriyor. Quick Play özelliği ile direk şarkınızı yapıyorsunuz ve 43 saniyelik bir mp3 dosyası olarak exportlayabiliyorsunuz. Hikaye modundaki 3 tane jam'i de birleştirip 80 saniyelik bir mp3 dosyası olarak exportlayabiliyorsunuz. Burada da açıkça Unity3D motorunun zorlandığını görebiliyoruz. Bayaa uğraşılmış bir başarılı oyun. Bir fikiri gayet güzel bir şekilde başarmışlar. Tebrikler. Bence 10/10 muhteşem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141710161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1603584615}
review:
Making random mixes your thing, but you don't have the time to learn complex software? This is a good place to start. You don't get to edit your own sounds, but you do get to manipulate the ones they provide. An added plus is that you get to kind of save some part of the universe with your bass.

Nothing wrong with that, IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989147801', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1550750352}
review:
I have searched for such a software since years: A game where I can create music in a game environment! When I have no inspiration to create my music in a DAW, I play around with this "game" where I have no must to create something good, just how I want!

Please more games like this!

As example a game as synthesizeer where I must create a special sound which are descriped in a text and to reach 100% I must reach the propertuies which are descriped in the text. The dimensions are: timbre, frequency curve, animation and pan. Every dimension can be descripted to reach a sound which you should get. and yes: decay phase.

This would be a real interesting game to learn and to have fun! :)
(I could help the developer because Im a professional DJ)

author: {'steamid': '76561197966720521', 'num_games_owned': 3409, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1645475038}
review:
Cosmic DJ es un juego realmente curioso como no había visto hasta ahora, aunque cabe señalar que también es un tanto abstracto.

Básicamente estamos ante un juego musical que nos propone crear fragmentos musicales para acompañar una base establecida a través de unas pocas misiones y conseguir llenar la barra de intensidad musical, para ello tendremos disponibles una serie de instrumentos seleccionados con únicamente 4 notas cada uno. Las dos formas para conseguir esto es o bien a base de tocar las notas en el momento que queramos para que vayan siendo grabadas, o bien utilizando un sistema "grid" que recuerda a los secuenciadores musicales profesionales. Todo esto en torno a una breve historia que nos inspira a seguir adelante, y que nos va mostrando unas simpáticas y a veces extrañas animaciones de fondo que reaccionan a nuestras interacciones.

Lo que más me sorprendió es que al final de la mayoría de misiones, el juego hace una especie de mezcla con los fragmentos que hicimos y crea una canción con algunos efectos, estas canciones incluso se pueden exportar a mp3. También nos deja crear una portada para el [i]single[/i] utilizando un pequeño editor integrado, aunque el tiempo se reduce a lo que el juego tarda en procesar la canción, por lo que no se puede crear nada decente en este sentido.

Si sueltas tu vena creativa puedes alargar la duración del juego a varias horas, si por el contrario te dejas llevar por la simplicidad de los ejemplos es muy probable que no te dure más de 1.

Lo recomiendo bastante para los que les gusten los juegos musicales experimentales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074241029', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1482947322}
review:
Гениальная игра для одаренных (нет) музыкальными способностями и раскрытия творческой (нетнет!) жилки.
Жаль мои друзья так и не оценили ни одного моего трека, говоря что я бездарность высшей степени. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198066346696', 'num_games_owned': 2239, 'num_reviews': 1253, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1678167158}
review:
Отличный "наркоманский" визуальный ряд (в смысле того, что происходит на экране пока "собираем мелодию"). На каждый инструмент есть "своя нелепица", происходящая на экране.
Хороша тем, что хаотично тыкая как попало, в итоге может получиться сносная музыка.
Плоха тем, что разнообразние ограничивается комбинациями 5 инструментов (+бонусными, которыми можно заменить 1-2 инструмента) и 4 их разными вариациями звучания (которые можно случайно протыкать и пройти игру даже так). А базируется она на одной из 5 мелодий, поверх которой и выставляем все инструменты.
Полученный музыкальный трек можно сохранить (и игра делает это крайне долго) и прослушивать в качестве 128 кбит/с. Не впечатляет, но зачем лучше?
Тематики этих мелодий: вначале обучение, потом воссоединение банды роботов, воспоминания влюбленной пары, воспоминания поссоривших друзей, пес c джетпаком (которого нужно собирать по частям: голова, тело и... джетпак) и последняя тема в виде истребления плохих "битов".
Вердикт: развлечение ровно на 1 час, в том случае, если хотите просто посмотреть и пройти игру. Можно притянуть еще 1 часик в надежде "сварганить" толковую музыку, но это не будет иметь какого-то особого смысла, т.к. все сделано в угоду простоте и, соотвественно, итоговому однообразию, как главному минусу. Подобной игре следовало выйти на флеше, там таких коротеньких и незатейливых полно - это сейчас просто мода на Юнити пошла.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998731470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1467835923}
review:
This game is not worth the 3€ it costs.
The music gets annoying really fast and you need absolutely no skill to finish the levels.
You can press any buttons and create whatever you want. You will pass the level even if the music sounds like shit.
I would not recommend playing this for longer than 30 minutes. You will get a headache.

Really weird game, I guess there might be people who enjoy playing this.
But when you are looking for a game which is based on good music you have to avoid this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031313794', 'num_games_owned': 8531, 'num_reviews': 3393, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1464620811}
review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Казуальный музыкальный психоделический симулятор диджея. Пять уровней каждый из которых со своей юморной и странной историей. Нам предлагают один из нескольких типов музыкальных инструментов в каждом из которых четыре вариации. Чередуя звуки мы создаем свою собственную уникальную мелодию, которую затем можно сохранить и послушать.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ Приятная глазу анимация с изрядной долей юмора.
¥ Самые разные звуки для нашего трека.
¥ Возможность сохранять наш трек в mp3.
¥ Нет достижений (спасибо... редкая игра в которой расслабляешься полностью и не хотелось бы отвлекаться на ачивки).

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Нет русского языка (он тут впринципе и не нужен. Управление интуитивно понятно, а текстовые вставки легко понять имея минимальную базу).
¥ Всего пять уровней.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Игра на час, в которой можно просто отдохнуть. Почувствуй себя космическим диджеем. Рекомендую.

[h1]Оценка: 6/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083100143', 'num_games_owned': 1638, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1464561743}
review:
[h1]Un giochino davvero originale[/h1]

Non aspettatevi chissà che: si tratta di un un giochino con una "trama" suddivisa in capitoli in cui, in ognuno di essi, dovremmo risolvere una brutta situazione WITH THE POOOWER OF MUUUSIC! il tutto premendo ritmicamente i tasti Z, X, C e V con vari suoni a nostro piacimento, il tutto verrà poi mixato in loop dal gioco creando un mp3 da 1:20 minuti, di cui potrete anche creare una cover. Tutto qui, ma per la sua ambientazione stramba e divertente, e per quel poco che dura (in media 2 ore e si finisce) e sopratutto che costa a parer mio merita di essere provato.

Consiglio l'acquisto sopratutto a chi cerca un giochino semplice e divertente con cui passare una mezz'oretta in tranquillità. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197964605430', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1462708398}
review:
STEVE4 has put out a whole bunch of bad vibes, and it is up to you - the titular Cosmic DJ, and STEVE3 - to save time and space with the power of MUSSIIC!

A gloriously over the top game that refuses to take it self seriously. Short and sweet, this is the very definition of a casual game - a 32-beat synthesiser, featuring a very small set of 4 tone samples - this feels more like a fad smartphone app than a fully fleshed out game. 

The limited synthesiser and sample collection (and the inability to expand with your own samples) means replayability is sadly limited, and once completed it is unlikely you will load it up again.

If you can get the game on sale, you would be foolish NOT to buy it, as you will easily get your monies worth in the two hours it takes to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054977723', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1523183825}
review:
Ame este juego, creas musica y te distraes un rato de tu vida. de cualquier manera tiene un par de cosas que me gustaria hablar. Primero es que la"campaña" no dura mas de 20 o 30 minutos y es muy facil hacerla, pero creo que la hicieron muy pero muy en broma. La segunda es que es me gustaria poder ver creaciones de otros usuarios compartir las mias e incorporar un par de instrumentos menos "electronicos".
Pero me encanta el hecho de que haya un juego tan simple y adictivo que merece la pena comprar en steam. Me encanta las bromas de la campaña y me encanta este juego. 7.5/10 es muy bueno pero le faltan cositas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988742738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1555290956}
review:
Great game- especially on sale.
In Cosmic DJ, you become... Well- a Cosmic DJ. Something has gone wrong, and STEVE4 has put bad vibes all over the JAMTENNA Network. You need to repair these JAMTENNAS with... THE POWER OF MUSIC!

All in all- great game, not a whole lot of replay value, but you'll enjoy it either way.
If you've liked the idea of programs that allow you to create your own music, but looks like too much work (FL studio, for example) this is for you. Jam out to some tunes you're added tracks on, and repair the JAMTENNAS.

The cosmos need you bro. You've got the good vibes to save it.

review:
Ja, es ist ein gutes Spiel mit einer netten Story, aber die Spielzeit von knapp einer Stunde ist eine Zumutung. Ich habe nur 0,74 Euro gezahlt und deshalb gibt es von mir auch eine positive Bewertung, mehr ist das Spiel aber wirklich nicht wert. Es wirkt so, als sei es mitten im Prozess abgebrochen worden, oder es war einfach eine Art Projekt "nur so zum Spaß".

Ich pflichte einem anderen Rezensenten bei, dass es bei den Aufgaben nur darum geht, die Songs mit möglichst vielen Noten zu füllen und nicht um die Qualität des Songs oder Ähnliches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161824596', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1598154281}
review:
Here is a list of Pros and Cons of the game.

[u][b]Cons[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Story line takes less than an hour...
This means after you complete the storyline, that's it, everything else you do from then on is not story driven, it's pretty much a studio from that point on. The developers could have stretched out the levels, and made more. But unfortunately there are only 5 levels, including the "boss battle". The reason I list this is because there was so much potential in creating bonds between the player and the characters, but just as soon as it happens, the game is over. Also, if you paid for a game that's 3 dollars, wouldn't you want a bit longer experience? That's 5 cents for every minute you play of the storyline.

[*]Instrument quality...
Some of the instruments sound really wierd and choppy, while others are pretty good, this is a bit bad because free play, from what I have seen (don't quote me on this but I didn't see the feature), is that you cannot choose what instruments to use, they are always randomized, could it inspire interesting sounds and songs? Yeah, but you should def have more control over what you get to use in freeplay.

[*]Failure to explain some mechanics
Now this one is questionable, because the main mechanic is making music, and filling the jam meter. But every once in a while, after I finish inserting the notes for a instrument, an explosive like tile floats across the screen to the right, and apparently if you click on it, it explodes or something, idk because the game didn't really tell me.

[*]Flashing Lights
I noticed that some of the lights in this game were actually a bit intense, not that I am epileptic, but if you are, you may want to consider not playing and I would stamp a warning on this game somewhere if it truely can trigger an epileptic seizure. I guess this one is debatable.

Alright, now for the Pros

[u][b]Pros[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Engaging and interesting visuals...
You like space? You like dogs? You like interactive backgrounds while you play? I sure do, and I did playing this game.

[*]Good music...
This is questionable, obviously, as you are the one making the music, but if you know at least a little bit of what you are doing, then the beats will get pretty epic.

[*]Exporting your music...
Yes, you can actually export your music, I plan on uploading mine to soundcloud because my mixtape is pretty fire, not gonna lie. But yeah, you can get a mp3 file of the song you just made, pretty cool.

[*]Innocent and charming atmosphere...
Many a times I found myself laughing at how cute and charming the characters were, I guess you could say that they charmed me ''WITH THE POWER OF MUSIC!!!!'
[/list]

But if you really like this game, buy it when it's for sale, so put it in your wishlist, and wait for the next sale, I got it for $0.74, which I feel was worth every penny. Honestly you could buy it for $3 and still feel content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281514138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1488574981}
review:
当天买的，下下来大概不到一小时就通关了。我玩的算比较慢的。通关很容易，音乐很带感，我尤其喜欢自己组织旋律的感觉。但是有一点弊端：游戏的默认键位只有四个。也就是说最多只有四个音。当然我不知道能不能设置多几个音之类的…如果不能的话，至少对于我来讲游戏体验受到了一定影响。当然你不能指望打完折不到1欧的游戏做的多么精致。无论从哪方面来讲来讲这款游戏都还挺超值的（针对打完折的价格）。
最后最重要的是：这游戏有毒！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198079944553', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1469727942}
review:
Short, sweet, and to the point.
This psychedelic trip of a game is very fun to mess around with. Overall there are about 6 'Areas' to play through and each one has 4 miniature 'stages' where you can play around with 5 different instruments/voxes. The backing tracks can only be changed a tiny bit through progression, the more stuff you put into a song the more options you might get to add into it even further. 
The story's funny to me personally, I rather liked the 'far out' voice of the narrator and the weird things that happen along the way. There's a charm to how simple this game is and honestly I couldn't stop playing once I picked it up.
The soundtrack is awesome, especially since the player has quite a bit of influence over it, and there's even more charm to be found in a game that lets you export your little creations to a folder on your computer for later listenings (it's automatic, so don't expect a deep, in-depth music creator here).

Even though the game is incredibly short (expect 2-4 hours depending on how much you want to screw around with the tracks) I found that it was definitely worth the price of admission. It doesn't hurt that I also got this game on sale for less than a dollar, but honestly even if it weren't on sale I'd still recommend it.

It's only $3, just don't eat lunch for like, one day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145497361', 'num_games_owned': 1281, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1462543364}
review:
80% OFF你买不到吃亏买不到上当。
这游戏就是让你过一把DJ瘾，随心所欲按照场景组合乐器音符，大多数时候只要不是纯粹乱敲，最后听到自己的成果大多都觉得挺带感的。而且居然还可以导出成MP3并且可以做封面，简直就是戳中我等中二老年的萌点啊！
这游戏耐玩性恐怕还是不要抱太大期待，但是绝对物超所值令人印象深刻。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067728231', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1460907678}
review: С небольшой усмешкой первый раз включал Cosmic Dj. Но на деле оказалась неплохая игра, а точнее конструктор музыкальных треков из уже заготовленных семплов. Но дизайн всего происходящего на экране и сама атмосфера космического путешествия - это конечно неперодоваемая яркоцветная эйфория. В некотором роде игра прививает любовь к электронной музыке, но если вы не из таких, то это не для вас.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141602674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1458243148}
review:
Cosmic DJ is a quick, "pick-up and play" musical experience about the joy of music creation for budding intergalactic musicians of all skill levels. Set among the stars, you will strive to become the legendary Cosmic DJ through six musical adventures as you’re tasked with repairing the all-important “Jamtennas” and bring harmony back to the galaxy. 
EXPLORE

Cosmic DJ includes a campaign mode that allows you, "The Cosmic DJ of Legend," to go through six adventures to repair the "Jamtennas" and bring musical harmony back to the galaxy! 

SEQUENCE YOUR JAM

Create your galactic beats with the intuitive, tap-based controls and the classic grid sequencer inputs with dozens of instruments from keyboards and drums to guitar and voice samples.

CREATE AND SHARE

A legendary DJ should not keep their creations for themselves so share your creations with the world by automatically creating and MP3 from your creations! Even create an album cover artwork with photos, stickers, and drawings to make it your own.
FEATURES

Tap/Grid Sequencer - tap out your own beats from a set of funky instruments or align them using the grid sequencer for perfect rhythm.
.MP3 Conversion - export your musical masterpieces and share with other budding Cosmic DJs.
Story Mode - repair the Jamtennas and bring the groove back to the galaxy.
Quick Play - just let the music take over without anything getting in your way.
My rating 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119820064', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1527947379}
review:
Cosmic Dj really lives up to its name by making you a dj in... space space space

I bought this game not expecting much from it aside from a potential seizure inducing meme experience. What I instead got was a brilliantly crafted game which let me make music (albeit terrible music I am not great at timing). 

Pros:
- Decent story line
- Easy to pick up (Lives up to the pick up and play aspect) 
- Great jams
- Lets you export your songs and make cover art for them.

Cons: 
- Too short. This game took me half an hour at most to finish. The story line while great, did feel like it could have more. 
- It felt like you had to use all of the tools provided in story mode.
- Lack of things to use to make cover art

Again, this game surprised me in the most pleasant of ways, and was well worth the price I paid for it. If any dlc comes out for this game that extends the story line or tools you get to use, you can bet I'll be buying it straight away. While the amount of items available to use to make cover art did put me off by a very very small amount, I would still recommend this game.

review:
Whoa ho ho! This game is a trip and a half and you can beat it in an hour! Plus, it's got replay value as well as the ability to save and export the MP3's you make. Who couldn't love that? 

Anyway, this is one of the most simplistic but super fun music games I've ever played. Help dispell all the bad vibes laid out by jamming out and helping put an end to problems with THE POWER OF MUSIC! It's funny, unique and sure to please. 

So go on a buy it, maaaaaan!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120956473', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1578468890}
review:
Это были лучшие 116 минут моей жизни.
В этой игре (если ее можно так назвать)вы можете почуствовать себя ДиДжеем
Да да вы не ослышались ДиДжеем.
Сюжет хоть и маленький но запоминающийся,можно вернутся в игру и делать свои песни(в бесконечном моде с выбором своих инструментов)которые потом игра сама замиксует и вы можете дать послушать своим друзьям(которые скорее всего будут абсолютным раком для слушателей,а для вас произведением искусства(ну или просто у меня такие кривые пальцы)).
Как я уже сказал присутствует маленький сюжет,но савмое интеренстное онечно же после миссий когда ты миксуешь все что ты намазюкал в ремикс.
Игру эту советую всем кто любит музыку и создание ее своими кривыми ручками.

review:
"THE POWER OF MUSIC!"

Ты диджей. В этом городе "Силы Музыки" ты лучше всех и тебе нет равных. Ты король битов и симуляции лая собак. Ты богат. Ты очень богат. Ты настолько богат, что вынюхал весь кокс и принял весь ЛСД этого мира. И теперь ты видишь этот грязный, чёрно-белый мир в цветных пикселях и красках. Да, детка, тебя штырит. Ты сочиняешь треки прямо на лету в своей голове, пока соседская собака бегает за сранными овечками, или пока ты летишь на воздушном шаре с какой то тян, а под тобой лошади в 3D очках стреляют лазерами. Ты познал силу дзена и клубной музыки и собрал Robot Band. Ты huyarish туц-туц-туц пока не услышишь "Свит Джэм!" Ты чувствуешь это? Это сила музыки, чувак. Войди в неё и слейся с двумерной наркоманской графикой и звуками колокольчиков.

Итог: 6,5 лишних звуков и семплов в треках из 10.

review:
This game is really fun to play and quite addicting. I like the simplicity of the game. You make music by the "Z,X,C,V" keys or by the music grid and thats it. Insta skrillex skills. The thing that would make this game better is getting to choose the exact type of instruments you play on "quick play". The instruments that are picked sometimes does not go well with each other and I dont like that. Overall still a great game.
I R8 this game 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064601344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1683366886}
review:
It's short, but sweet--one of those games where I could list a dozen flaws, then sit down & enjoy playing it. Not a whole lot of replay value if you have other music-making programs, but easily worth its sale or coupon price. Definitely one of those games you should play, rather than watch. If you must watch before playing, here's a video with no spoilers...

https://youtu.be/7NNgz8-TVY8

review: Wow, this game. It's short and sweet, and if I had to seriously consider what made this game so great... It's a game about the joys of music. You 'make' music, which is extremely simple, and it takes zero effort; but you feel great. You can't play the game without smiling and thinking to yourself 'Damn, this sounds pretty good. I'm pretty good. The world is awesome.'

author: {'steamid': '76561197974313093', 'num_games_owned': 2076, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1674156454}
review:
Like a dodgy handshake on a foreign dancefloor, you'll walk away with a sugar pill in your hand and wonder what the fuck you're doing with your life. 10 minutes into this game, you'll think you're the next Moog Jesus but all your disciples are banging meth in your kitchen. 

10 speedballs / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198236680488', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1457787179}
review:
Muito bom!!
No começo (EU) tive um pouco de dificuldade pra criar musicas boas, mais era pq eu não tava 
conseguindo achar o ritmo certo  . Depois de algumas horas consegui pegar o ritmo e fazer musicas fodas de mais.
Uma das coisas que gostei muito no game foi: você poder criar a arte de cada album que você faz da pra fazer umas artes muito lindas.
o game e 10/10 e pelo preço que comprei ele (na promoçao)
fica 12/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198073530606', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1512979302}
review: Though it is an epileptic's worst nightmare / probably one of the most chill games you will ever play in your lifetime, look no further than Cosmic DJ if you want to immerse yourself in synthetic rhythm for hours on end. There's a brief story that lasts about 90 minutes, give or take, but it's very worth the money for that alone. This game is great, [i]maaaaaan.[/i] It'll tune out your bad vibes in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100398972', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1451132595}
review:
Its a great music maker game that was really fun and has alot of potenial it just needs a few things and this game could be really great.
1.Frist off to be able to pacficly chose what intruments you will use instead of random selection
2.long notes makeing the sound go for longer instead of many beats
3.choose how long you want the mix to be
4.and a mode only with the sounds u make (no backround sounds)
5.being able to change the backround

ive only played an hour but the games great with these idears im pretty sure the game will get alot more profit.
6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198135346587', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1554184817}
review:
Meu, esse jogo é incrivel cara!
Eu queria esse jogo a um tempo, mas acabei esquecendo de comprar, daí vieram as promoções, e eu acabei vindo olhar o preço que já não era caro, mas tava uma pechincha! Comprei!
Acho que... foram os melhores 1,57R$ que já gastei na minha vida!

Pelas fotos o jogo parece muito bom, mas em si, é PERFEITO! As musicas que dá pra criar são muito bem elaboradas e o melhor, dá pra ser criativo e criar um "Som Dahora".
Sem falar dos gráficos, antes de comprar eu achei que fosse uma bobeira, mas o jogo me teleportou pro espaço literalmente! Perfeito! Vale a pena jogar esse jogo a noite, os efeitos de Luzes que ele tem junto com as musicas... Awesome!
Vale muito a pena comprar esse jogo, o preço mesmo sem desconto vale cada centavo pago pelo jogo.
Nota: 10/10 
Sem dúvidas esse jogo vale a pena, eu o compraria denovo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000333531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1451513759}
review: The game is fun, but on start up it has a 50% chance of crashing and stalling out my mouse scrolling for all other applications including task manager and windows explorer. :( Other than the literal unplayability, the game is an addaptive new way to make or synth" some cool music. The story line is hallarious and the gameplay is addicting. I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970584926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1597874612}
review:
This is one weird, um, game? Not sure if this can be called game but more like a toy. But at least this is freshly different from many other games.

Basically player is DJ who is putting together music tracks. Light story and funny, slightly psychedelic animated pixely graphics are giving you inspiration while making your tracks. After each track is finished, you can save it as mp3 with your own cover art.

Game is helping out and throwing lots of compliments in progress. I enjoyed this even though I don't know pretty much anything about making music. And I was actually quite happy with my first "Cosmic Jam, vol. 1" :D

People who actually know something about music might feel and see (hear) this game very differently. For me this was fun experiment. Not my favorite games but has been already worth of that few euros it costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015344213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1524479691}
review:
This game is pretty cool and I would definitely recommend it. Like others have said it feels more like a children's toy than a video game. For the price, this is a fantastic bargain for such a good "toy" that even parents will want to play with... for a little while.

If you are familiar with using a DAW/music production in general you will probably get a big kick out of this for the first few levels but that feeling will wear off pretty quickly. 

There is always a premade beat going on in the background along with various synths/voices and the provided "kits" are very very similar to eachother and are very limiting. For me personally, these things are very hard to look past.

Although this review sounds more on the negative side, I still highly recommend it.

To end on a more positive note, I recreated Darude - Sandstorm with dog barks and I smile whenever I think about it.

Enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055981406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1445464645}
review: This is not really a game, but rather an experience.  There is no challenge in actually completing the levels, the fun comes from just doing it, enjoying your creations, letting the experience flow.  The voiced story has gotten some laughs out of me, but I am not rushing through the levels.  Let yourself enjoy the music.  The remixed tracks that the game saves after a level actually do sound pretty good, though not quite at the level where I would want to download them and add them to my regular music rotation.  But knowing I had some hand in making them and that it was extremely easy and fun to do so makes them special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125613069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1445017445}
review:
I bought Cosmic DJ in the Humble Bundle Summer Sale. I think I paid around £0.69 for it and for that price it both entertained and annoyed me for a while.

The game has 5 pros I can think of.

Cut Scenes
I think the cut scenes are the best thing about the game and they had me laughing quite a few times. Steve3 is what made the cut scenes entertaining.

Music
The backing tracks in the levels are actually really good as standalone tracks.

Sliders
I really like the fact there were volume sliders, that I did not expect and they were great for muting unwanted instruments.

Exporting
Anything you create can be exported as an mp3 which is great.

Price
It was very cheap when I bought it and I think it was a fair price, I don't think I would pay full price for it though.

There are 4 main cons when it comes to gameplay.

Instruments
I was limited to a only a handful of different instruments to choose from and though the majority were nice sounds some of them would not fit into anything that was playing so I just ended up muting them. Each stage used slight variations of the exact same instruments which got very repetitive.

Notation
I could not make my own melodies or basslines, instead I was limited to 4 predetermined notes/hits which sometimes clashed with the backing track. Because the backing tracks were basically full tracks already they could end up sounding far too busy when your own notes/hits were added.

Mandatory number of notes
I did not like having to have a mandatory number of notes in the sequencer to be able to move to the next section. Sometimes the instruments or notation were sounding far too busy but I still needed a certain number of notes to carry on, when that happened I would just mute an instrument and put in as many notes as possible to get to the next section. This felt like the only way to progress without making something that sounded way too busy and this took the fun out of the game.

Steve4
Steve4 just ruined everything with his incredibly annoying voice.

Maybe I'm taking a casual music based game too seriously or maybe because I do quite a bit of music production I've come to expect too much when it comes to any sort of music creation. Either way I feel like the game was a bit of a let down, a mildly entertaining let down.

Even though it has it's faults I would still recommend the game to anyone with a passing interest in music creation or some time to waste.

At the time of this review the price for this game is £0.49, it's worth it for that price

author: {'steamid': '76561197986997917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1445090634}
review:
This game is awesome for those of us who like simple music composition. The game is just very well made; animations respond to your music, the music itself is simple but enjoyable, and at the end of each section you get to save a remix of what you've composed to your computer. I paid 74 cents for this game and got 1.8 hours of solid entertainment.

Bonus feature: The game is totally G rated and would be perfect for children to explore music creation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043346855', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 630, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1590916433}
review:
At first I was disappointed by its limitations, but as I got further into the game, you get more diverse sets of instruments, and you develop the skills to layer music in an enjoyable, more strategic way.  Either way, the game is always entertaining and humorous.  Though levels vary in quality, the game is a great experience if you can get in the zone and make something great - helped by the background music prompting you with cues.  A creative intro to sequencers.

The ability to export your songs and give them cool album art is terrific icing on the cake: a permanent way to remember what you did.  Putting a timer on album art creation was also a good way to keep things spontaneous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119704724', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1438655624}

author: {'steamid': '76561198173959899', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1527329396}
review:
Набор звуков, зачастую не подходит друг к другу, так сказать тебе дают 5-ть инстрментов которые никоим образом не созвучны, а ты должен что-то из этого создать (если играть по сюжетной линии). И на счет записи треков в mp3 форматах. Да, это здесь можно, но знаете в чем подвох? В том что когда вы создали свой идеальнейший трек, при записи в mp3 формат игра автоматически его миксует самым ужасным образом, и из-за этого вы получаете не собственный трек, а изуродованную, просшедшую через многое дeрьм0 (возможно через все круги Ада) миксовку своего трека. Значит каковы наши минусы? 
- Автоматическая миксовка при обработке в mp3
- Несвязно данные инструменты
Это одни из топовых минусов, а по мелочи, это не столь важно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048636457', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1516372863}
review:
適当にボタンを押してるだけでいい感じの曲が勝手に完成するアレ系のソフト。
一応ストーリーっぽいのがあって４ステージくらいある。
でも結局適当にボタンを押したら曲が出来るソフトです。

完成後には作った曲を元にいい感じに再構成してmp3に変換してくれる。
変換中は曲のジャケットを背景とスタンプと組み合わせて作るフェイズになります。
こっちの方が面白い。制限時間が短いし操作性もいまいちだし素材も少ないけど。

クリアだけなら１時間かかりません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198195319728', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1432852497}
review:
Sólo tienes que descargar un paso secuenciador libre como hidrógeno .

Tenga en cuenta que si bien barato, este juego tiene sólo alrededor de un centenar de minutos de juego. No ofrece un secuenciador por pasos especialmente featureful o poderoso . Dudo que voy a tocar de nuevo.

Este es un tutorial gamified para utilizar un secuenciador por pasos . Si el juego era mucho más tiempo e introdujo más y más características de los principales secuenciadores por pasos y sí había un completo uno integrado, que sería mejor . Sería bueno si pudiera llegar al punto en que esto produce resultados similares a lo que puede lograr con algo como el hidrógeno . Como es , sin embargo, sólo hay unas pocas estructuras de las canciones orden interna , sus secuencias se limitan a 8 bares , y no hay ningún tipo de editor de canciones ni ningún tipo de automatización para la mezcla o efectos .

El contenido de este juego es más o menos limpio, por lo que podría ser bueno si tienes niños .
ademas.solo si sabes ingles podes jugarlo si no sabes ingles no entendes nada es una cagada encima esta pago 

En Fin Recomiendas este juego??
NO!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970971433', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1679428252}
review: I really enjoyed playing this game, but it isn't for everyone. It isn't complex and hard to learn. The game is quite simple, which is perfectly fine for me. It is trippy, silly, ridiculous, and I love it. You don't actually make a whole entire song though. You'll make parts of a song and the game puts it together to make a short song. If you're looking for something serious, go elsewhere. If you want to just dick around and have fun, then this game might be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971369815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1453321488}
review:
This is the BEST game on Steam. You can finish it and ask for refound!!! 

PL:
Najlepsza gra na Steam! Możesz ją ukończyć i otrzymać zwrot kasy. Polecam... nie kupować. Szkoda kasy.

More: 

Good:
- Graphics: DJ on drugs
- It's funny
- You can convert your track to mp3 format = sweet revenge on neighbor who listens dubstep 24/h
- You can make music to scare the rats from the basement
- Finish it -> refound -> buy another game = profit

Bad:
- Price
- "Story mode" is VERY short
- "Quick Play" is useless: you can't choose instruments. Game chooses random sets :/
- You have just few seconds to make cover for song

author: {'steamid': '76561198145566896', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1461160056}
review:
This is an amazing game. That's a rhythm game, but not only a rhythm game. This game allows you make your own DJ music by your self, and you can even export your DJ rhythm into a MP3 file. That's very cool, right? You can feel like you are DJ. So, from all, it's a game which very worth to buy.
这款游戏非常精彩！它是一款音乐游戏，但是不仅仅只是一部音乐游戏而已。这款游戏允许你制作你自己的DJ音乐，而且你甚至可以将你自制的旋律导出为一个MP3文件，这真的很有趣。这款游戏让你有一种变成DJ的感觉，所以综上所述，这是一个非常值得买的游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198065006673', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1433236120}
review:
음악적 감각이 뛰어난 사람이라면 다양한 음악이 완성되어 파일로 나오니 신기하고 유용할 겁니다.
소위 약빤것 같은 그래픽도 마음에 들긴 했었고요.

...하지만, 제가 만들면 단 한가지 타입의 음악만 나옵니다. 음악적 감각과 지식이 옅다곤 하지만, 분명 다른 스테이지로 만들었는데 3개 다 똑같은 도입부...하아...

결론은, 음악 좀 만들 줄 아는 사람한테는 추천합니다만, 아니라면 다시 생각해봐야 합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993930568', 'num_games_owned': 5393, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1441717680}
review:
The animations and "story" are good and fun but the game itself is dull and badly-thought out, it seems.

It's basically a 4 line sequencer you can build up with either a step sequencer or by hitting pads. The problem is that success is basically guaranteed just by putting a lot of notes in. It also seems to be the case that you _have_ to put lots of notes in, even if you think it sounds better with fewer in, and it does sound better with fewer in because you don't start out with silence to begin with: there are sounds going on before you even add anything yourself.

Also any melodic instruments only have 4 possible positions so that limits any tunes you might want to play

author: {'steamid': '76561197986210588', 'num_games_owned': 2745, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1441635046}
review:
This game should be renamed to Noisy DJ

The best part of this game is the narrator, the music soundtracks (that you can't change) are actually well made.
The instruments and sequencer part of the game which are actually the gameplay where you " compose " music I found to be just noisy and not very musical funny at all. 

I would prefer expending time with Cakewalk than playing this gone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996314287', 'num_games_owned': 4388, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1441278886}
review:
A really fun romp through a limited DJ game/experience. You get out of it as much as you put into it, but the 2hrs I spent were really enjoyable. Even if you don't know anything about music this is a nice short time spent, with limited functions it's literally just a casual toy. It records the music you "make" as well, complete with cheesy cover art. Probably something you could replay as well to make variations on the tracks.

NOT recommended for people who don't like techno or bleep-bloop music.
HIGHLY recommended for people who like 80's-90's techno/synth music.

Probably good for $1 or so
