author: {'steamid': '76561198032521661', 'num_games_owned': 682, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1441139336}
review:
Un gros trip WTF.

C'est marrant, si on essaye de speedrunner le jeu, il doit se finir en une vingtaine de minutes max : le système de notations des loops se base plus sur le nombre de fois qu'on utilise chaque instrument, donc en spammant zxcv comme un gros porc on a des notes de ouf. Mais la musique produite comme ça est moche.

Et c'est ce qui fait la force de ce jeu : une fois dedans, on s'en fiche d'aller vite, on essaye plusieurs combinaisons de notes et de timings on termine la boucle avec les trucs qui nous plaisent le plus, tout en essayant d'atteindre le maximum de la note possible. Les combinaisons sont assez simples : pour un instrument, 4 notes / variations sont disponibles, sur des boucles de 4 secondes divisées en 32 notes maximum, ce qui est PEU pour un usage musical approfondi.

Mais là encore, c'est très intelligent : le jeu est TRES simple à prendre en main, et en quelques minutes, on arrive à produire une boucle accrochante (au moins pour nous). A partir de ces boucles, le jeu va automatiquement créer une piste sonore en mettant bout-à-bout quelques boucles (toutes celles crées dans chaque "jamtenna") et en nous proposant de créer un cover art. Et même si la musique n'est pas forcément énorme, on est toujours content de la récupérer (en MP3 !), parce qu'on peux y avoir passer bien 20 minutes et que c'est toujours super gratifiant de se dire "Ouais j'ai créé un truc !"

Puis outre la musique, les graphismes sont COMPLETEMENT WTF, des fois il y a des trucs qui apparaissent (discrètement, ça se fond bien dans le décor) sur l'écran on sait pas pourquoi, mais c'est parfaitement cohérent avec la musique produite (du techno/trance ? J'ai jamais su les classer) et au final, le jeu est plutôt drôle (enfin il fait sourir, pas rire aux éclats), bien fini et de plus en plus agréable à l'oreille.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138384660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1507278839}
review:
Ни в коем случае не жалейте 80 рублей на этот шедевр.
Игра простая, но очень увлекательная. Нужна просто попадать в ритм данной вам мелодии и в любом случае получится Sweeeeeeet Jam!
Смысл простой, и несмотря на плохие знания инглиша я его понял.
Красочная графика и дизайн, чего стоит одна кукла-перчатка, которая хвалит тебя.
Покупайте игру и используйте СИИИИЛУУУ МУУУЗЫЫЫЫКИ!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990742852', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1440888842}
review:
Those of you who had a Playstation may remember the classics Fluid (or even Music 2000) and Parrapa the Rapper, imagine you mix the two....well playing this you don't really have to imagine that's what it is and it's great. The only thing that would improve it are more sounds, a slightly more advanced system (though you wouldn't want it too complicated as this is clearly meant to be simple to play for a reason!) and more levels would be great but it's good enough as is especially when it's so cheap. 

One for playing when you get back from the pub/club or maybe under the influence of anything else (no illegal substances though....no...defiantely not).

review:
Un jeu totalement barré qui vous emmenera dans un univers psychédélique. Le principe est simple et la musique rythmée (heureusement puisqu'il s'agit d'un jeu musical) et les missions proposées sont amusantes et totalement barrées. 
Un point négatif est que le jeu se termine très rapidement selon moi mais je n'en attendais pas plus d'un petit jeu indé !

author: {'steamid': '76561198129579508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1439555347}
review:
[h1]Брат, братан, братишка, когда меня отпустит ?[/h1]

Казуалочка с простенькой электронной музыкой, где нам дадут такую возможность как создание собственной музыки.
Нелепой, простой, но все же своей, родной.

Вы получите массу фана и удовольствия от прохождения этой игры. 
Правда есть один большущий минус, продолжительность игры оставляет желать лучшего.

А вот что касается атмосферы... ну это надо увидеть самому. 
Где вам ещё удастся увидеть поющую собаку под кокаином ?

8/10 пакетиков со спайсом.

С уважением Zordaks, Ораторы Ste@m

author: {'steamid': '76561198116383084', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1439981066}
review:
Cosmic DJ

Купил посмотрев на кучу положительных отзывов,"ушной оргазм","почувствуй себя диджеем". 
На самом деле единственное, что хорошо звучит в этой игре(если это игра),это фоновые звуки в меню ,они качественно сделаны,что касается самой игры,  "Оргазма " не было ,точнее визуальный был,ибо куча наркомании в мониторе рядом стоящих по-любому озадачит ,но вот звуки для создания "песенки" слабые,не и выбор их мал. Хоть игра и стоит 79р ,можно было по качественнее сделать здесь всё в этом плане, если вы хотите иммено ушного оргазма я вам советую такие вещи как  incredibox (бесплатно в браузере залипнуть на долго- ибо уже вышло 4 версии этого чуда) ,ну и как вариант beaterator ,правда с этой вещью другие проблемы ибо есть она только на консоль PSP и  на IOS ,ну я думаю кто фанат ,тот заценит. 

Что по игре 
Визуальный ряд 9\10
Звук 7\10
Гемплей 5\10
Продолжительность всей этой
 наркомании всего час,
потому 5\10,
можно сделать дольше

Итого 6.5\10
Можно взять (но на любителя)

author: {'steamid': '76561198009067077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1439960490}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033585486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1458809609}
review:
Like doing a ton of acid with your dog, this game will seem fun to play; but after your ride with the purple dragon it will still be FUN to play. Save the music torn galaxy, or create a mad tune, this game will steal time away. Look at you though, you don't care. Creative is the most you'll want out of this, as you create mad tunes for your pleasure (or hers) only. I am still playing this for some reason, and can't figure out why?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114313252', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1448377759}
review:
Всем привет и сейчас я тебя раскажу про игру космик диджей. Игра просто шикарная. всё началось с того что я купил её за 11 р на акции, но прежде прочитал отзывы. Как написал 1 человек что он ощутил ушной оргазм или чтото типо того. НУ и я решил проверить, что за игра. Я был в восторге. ЗДесь вы не только проходите по сюжету сочиняя музыку, но вы можете и сохранить её себе. 
Я сам ничего не умею в музыкальном плане да и возможности нету, но в этой игре (по моему мнению) я сочинил охренненые треки. 
Игра 9 из 10
-1 балл за то что сюжет короткий прошёл за час.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988802777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1439765277}
review:
As a game, this sucks.  Maybe two hours of gameplay at most if you mess around an awful lot.  The scoring system is junk, preferring lots of notes to good sounding combinations of notes.  The instruments?  Most of them are god awful, and there isn't a single game mode where you can select the ones you want to use.
That said, it's quirky, it's entertaining, and provides a valuable very basic introduction to simple music sequencing.  If that sounds appealing to you, then pick it up, play your two hours, and move onto a proper software synth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056385984', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1439743763}
review:
[B]POWER OF MUSIC![/B]

Иногда играть в трэш - это круто. А в хороший трэш за одиннадцать рублей - вообще прекрасно.

Очень простая казуалочка с очень простой электронной музыкой, основная задача которой - создавать музыку. Электронную, посредственного качества, но все же оригинальную, свою. 

Вы получите уйму фана, вам даже не придется напрягаться [strike]особенно если вы уже обдолбаны[/strike]... Но игра очень короткая. Это чертовски большой минус.

Итого: размениваете одиннадцать рублей на часик упоротого эпилептического сюжета, а так же покупаете дешевую утилиту для записи POWER OF MUSIC!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141088800', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1440092513}
review: This is an oddly entertaining game. The I like that there are a couple of ways that you can jam your tunes, and doesn't matter how bad you are at it, it can actually sound pretty cool! I'm not sure if it can be labeled as a game, but it sure is fun and it rather humourus. I got it on sale, and glad I did. I wouldn't pay more for it, but it was worth the sale cost I think for a little laid back fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053563819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1479029011}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031306027', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1443200915}
review:
这款游戏的内容是往一段背景音乐里加上各式各样的声音，比如 吉他·贝斯·钢琴·人声·机械·8Bit·FX 等等各种音色，在预告片里也可以看到可以以小节的方式来添加节拍，用过FL Studio编曲软件的人可能会更容易熟悉这款游戏的内容。所以这个游戏的受众面是对音乐感兴趣的玩家，而且可以让玩家尝试一下编出自己的曲子的感觉。
令我感到惊艳的一点是，在你完成一个关卡后，结尾会生成你在这一关的编辑成果，你可以导出你自己“做”出来的mp3格式音乐，来向你的小伙伴炫耀啦~~~~虽说游戏音乐的节奏感鲜明，所有人做出来的曲子都不会差到哪里，可是有水平的作品还是能听出差距的。不知道大家的作品怎么交流 , 我就在这里放上一个我做的算了  。....。：[url=http://pan.baidu.com/s/1qWutQHI]Cosmic DJ[/url]
这个是游戏原来未添加任何音色的背景音乐[url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/297110/discussions/0/34093781688136095/]：Cosmic DJ原背景音乐[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197986602024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1439671434}
review: С небольшой усмешкой первый раз включал Cosmic Dj. Но на деле оказалась неплохая игра, а точнее конструктор музыкальных треков из уже заготовленных семплов. Но дизайн всего происходящего на экране и сама атмосфера космического путешествия - это конечно неперодоваемая яркоцветная эйфория. В некотором роде игра прививает любовь к электронной музыке, но если вы не из таких, то это не для вас.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220687216', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1483438022}
review: Лучше чем osu!, только Cosmic DJ. На самом деле это шутка, однако Cosmic DJ довольно неплохой музыкальный симулятор, который обеспечит вам пару часов интересного психоделического позитива, а также возможность почувствовать себе [b]космо-диджеем[/b]. Брать я конечно [b]не рекомендую[/b], для этого есть куда более интересные музыкальные симуляторы, например условно-бесплатная osu!  Не помню чтоб проект издавался под руководством [b]Devolver Digital [/b], наверное в то время, у авторов был кризис на игровые новинки и употребив небольшое количество зелёного вещества, у них возникла идея издать малоизвестный инди-проект. Карты так не добавили, а это знаете ли один из главных видов заработка инди-разработчика, после распродажи игры по скидке и участие в bundle.., впрочем о чём это я? [b]Ждите скидку[/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561198055926013', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1441470306}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990695056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1439615356}
review:
best cosmic trip ever

would ride on THE POWER OF MUSIC again 11/10 

this is not a rhythm game, or even much of a game at all, but it IS great, quirky fun, a journey into playful, often bizarre places that just happen to be filled with pretty good jams.  

this is not a proper sequencer, but it doesn't need to be, because it's intended to be lighthearted, silly enjoyment that might just occasionally break out into awesometude.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099698764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1489826393}
review:
超级魔性的游戏，绝对好评，买了不会后悔的。从此治好喜+1

review:
Picked this up for $0.59 in a sale.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qckc5cI4fG0&index=19&list=PLBonlAW_WHtxNcg43Hd9zv7j-FnGClIlj

Pros - The game is weird, and uses the term Jamtenna, and Harshing my vibes.

Cons - The game is weird, and uses the term Jamtenna, and Harshing my vibes.

Seriously though, it is a simple sequencer that provides you with different sound effects to Jam out and beat the villain "Steve4"

I had a great 2 hours playing it, but if you get put off by repetitive beats then maybe avoid it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199218662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1439609419}
review:
If you're expecting gameplay, look elsewhere, as this is more of a software toy than anything else. A Short 90 minute story mode is all you get, but the actual game itself is a sequencer in the form of music chords and sound samples. You get to setup the timing using four buttons, Z, X, C, and V and listen to the results. If you like how it sounds, move on to the next sound set, and if not, fix it. I got the game at 85% off, but even if you pay full price, just understand that it's more of a music creator; heck, you even get to save your "Jams" as an MP3 to listen anytime!

Aside from that, however, there is nothing that would make me come back to play this game again, thought your milage may vary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049747450', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1440362396}
review:
こりゃ…こりゃすげーよ。
ゲームとは言い切れない。だって、それっぽいリズムだったら何でもOK出ちゃうと思う。
ゆっくり考えていい。好きなだけいじっていい。
納得するものを作ればいい。そんなゲームあるか！？（あるよ）

要はリズムパッド。カオシレーターとかよりよっぽどしょぼい、アンドロイドで無料アプリでもある感じの
でもね、ステージごとに違う音源を掴まされて、バックビートとかテンポは与えられたりしててね
そんな中試行錯誤で一つの音楽を作る！
3ステージほど作る！
最後に全部がうまくMIXされた曲をエクスポート出来る！！！！
もう最高ですよ。サイコーーーーですよ。ノリノリですよ。
この楽しさの前にはゲーム性がどうとか野暮ですよ。

https://youtu.be/iC0SlFl1g-w

自分のファーストプレイ

author: {'steamid': '76561198020976982', 'num_games_owned': 1049, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1439539267}
review:
It's fun to play, I have to say, and even if I smash those keys, the result is not that bad. 

But, remember, this is not a good sequencer. You can't draw a line in the sequencer to create a lot of notes, you can't add effect to those notes manually, and if you use your keyboard to record the notes, there's a latency so it's not that easy to put those notes at what you want. Plus you have no idea you are on beat or not.

But well, anyway, want to get some random music? Just play this game. 

Give it 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992444114', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1616657858}
review:
Basically it's a very fun, very trippy, music making game, think minecraft figures on a fluro trip with music...

You are given a set of challenges and within each, you are provided a set of instruments. For each instrument you are provided 4 tones from the instrument. You can then choose which order these are played...on a backdrop of a repeating music beat. The aim is to fill a meter of "enjoyment" for the characters in the game and after making a track combining all your instruments and their tones, you can even export your track to listen to later.. but the best part is that the pixel block scenery and characters actually pulse in flurotastic colour..to the beat you are creating..

Highly recommended if your into the trippy visuals--sort of game ;)

Literally the only downside for me would be that it doesn't support  controller input....but this could be fixed in a future update..we never know! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198151107408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1439595820}

review:
Игра довольно неплохая, но вот только с оптимизацией и русификатором проблема.
На английском языке почти нечего не понятно, но известно то, что действия происходят в космосе и нам надо взбодрить 4 станции создавая музыку под какие-то бессмысленные случаи жизни. При этом нам нужно нажимать всего несколько кнопок.
Игра мне понравилась не очень т.к. музыкальные файлы получаются говно - как это можно слушать а вроде тыкаю все правильно!  БРЕД Крч!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047371112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1449383470}
review:
A minigame made of bizarre visuals and the very essence of synth pop music.

Gameplay is rather plain but the experience is, spectacular i would say. The cover art editor is impressively simple and beautiful, and you can export to mp3 files feeling like the coolest dj ever. Although it is already a "game" no like others, i think if they can add more possibilities to the jamming process, for instance, a game mode to choose instruments freely, and even generally make more and more portion of the music, remix by adding sound effects and loops, etc., it would be a masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040514281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1452646092}
review:
A very nice, cheap little game, you -can- make songs in this, but if you like rhythm based sandboxes, a new term I coined there, this is a game you should pick up, I got it on sale for about 67 pence, less than one pound, so I had nothing to lose, it was 1 AM and I was bored, by 2 AM I was still on it.

Very fun if you like rhythm, very fun if you like synthy stuff and if you liked the Anthem creator feature on Spore, you're in for a treat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045326675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1441283304}
review:
This game is very simple and very fun to just mess around with.  
Being able to create simple beats and feel like you have control over how the song plays out is a cool idea and is brought out well considering. It is easy to go in and create a beat of your own with and you do not need to be a wiz with music making to do it well.  However this is where the negatives start to kick in.  In the game you go between 4-5 different instruments and create beats with essentially 4 different notes....and that's it really. There are bonus loops or instruments that can appear and give you the option of changing your current instrument with the new one or have the option of selecting new music in general.  Besides this there is no other way to make or alter music.  This is where the simplicity will be seen as a negative.  You are not able to fade music in or out, change the BPM, and there is no way to edit your samples the way YOU want after you create them.  The game will automatically edit the samples together which may make your song sound better or worse.  It is a shame that if you want to make advanced samples or create your own songs your out of luck really.  It took me 3 hours to go through the entire "story" section but I will say I had a lot of fun playing through it.  Even though you have limits to the kind of music you can make it is still a fun expereince that is worth that little bit of money it costs to play it.  People looking for an advanced music maker to make samples and great tracks would probably get nothing from this, but for players looking for a simple and fun music creation game to mess around and have fun with then there is nothing wrong with this game.  Did I forget to mention any song you finish you can save and export it to your music library on you computer to listen to whenever you want (even if the songs are just 1 minute long).  A lot of neat ideas in this game I just wish there would be options for more advanced options to give people freedom to create even more awesome tracks.    However because the game only costs a couple of dollars my negatives really are just minor.        Cosmic DJ get's a 7/10 From me.  "It's good for what it provides you for a few dollars and gives you a fun time while providing cool and silly visuals that will put a smile on your face."
+Fun samples and good beat
+Great Price
+Easy to pick up and play
+Able to Export your music converted automatically to MP3 to your computer library
+/- Length of game is short but is reasonable considering price
-Simplistic and does not offer any advanced means to create some real creative samples and tracks
-some samples that you HAVE to use don't feel like they fit in the song your making
-no way to select what instrument for when you create custom tracks

author: {'steamid': '76561198009961300', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1499095595}
review:
I read the reviews that said "for all skill levels," and I thought to myself 'I am of a skill level.' I'm definitely not an expert, and I haven't published any songs, but if you're looking for something that is *NOT* a frustratingly simple version of schismtracker (it only give you 4 notes per instrument), keep looking. It has a cute story, but the actual gameplay seems ambiguous. You could spam the same note for 32 beats in in the 2 measure loop and it would tell you that you're awesome. Like, it just needs a certain number of notes in the loop to progress.

I'm not saying don't get this game, but if it's more than a dollar, you may want to hold off.
I paid a dollar.

review:
This is the most fun 2 hours I've had in a loooong time, and I've bought and replayed a ton of games in the last few months. The story mode gives you 5 neat scenarios, 4 tracks to build in each, and 4 perfectly picked instruments per song. All you have to do is press 4 buttons to make wicked cute and danceworthy space jams :D

Buy your friend a copy and fix those Jamtennas with THE POWER OF MUSIC!!!! *violently shakes screen and throws a bucket of neon colours in your eyeholes*

author: {'steamid': '76561197981029327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1462916568}
review:
I bought it when it was last on sale. Not sure how much I payed for it. Normally I wouldn't buy a game like this, or really indie games this was just something to spend the remainder of my money on. Also, because my brother had a music sequencer app on his phone, and that influenced me to get this as well.

At first I wasn't that intersted in it. Now that I've put some time into it, and understand how to create music a bit better it's more fun. It's actually really easy to create a song. I call it song, but really it's just a loop. I haven't played too much of the main story just one jamtenna. That was when I first got it. Since then I've been messing with quickplay. 

It reminds you a lot of Katamari Damaci. Seems very Katamari Damaci inspired. 

I can't really convince you to buy it. I mean it seems like you would either be interested in it, or not. Music maker games were always a niche. 

The only things I wish this game had were......
-Ability to choose own instruments in quickplay (which isn't that much of a bother really. maybe cosmic dj 2? :D)
-Ability to save the loop unremixed. Most of my loops sound better remixed anyways, but still... Maybe you just want the loop?
-Ability to tap along to your song while it's playing and the instrument not laying down on the track. Like when I'm choosing my instruments I can play with them, and tap out a beat with that specific instrument. If I do it while I am creating a song it lays down on the track, and I can't expirement with those instruments without it repeating!


Creating song's is addicting though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069107867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1478188372}
review:
Auch wenn ich ein Musik-Game-Junkie bin und gerne sowas spiele... aaaaber... man kann da wirklich jeden Mist da hineinpacken und die größten Disharmonien erzeugen und dennoch wird das autogenerierte Publikum deinen Songs lauschen und diese als aufwendigen Erfolg deklarieren.

Sorry wenn ich das mal so sage, aber selbst wenn das Game dann nur noch Harmonien akzeptieren würde, wäre das Spiel für experimentierfreudige Menschen nix mehr. Es ist ja so, Musik ist Geschmackssache.

Hier war die Absicht einen "Musik-Maker" mit beschränkten Möglichkeiten zu machen. Es ist vollkommen geglückt.

Grafik ist der Knaller, Musikauswahl ist auch sehr schön... aber wie gesagt es fehlt der Anreiz, da man jedes Level mit jeden Mist schaffen kann. Das ist so wie wenn man dich mit kostenlosen Eis bewirft. Man hat einfach nicht viel dafür geleistet. Dann doch lieber sagen: "Mehr Funktionen" einbauen und eine Art Magix daraus gestalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065549511', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1435817112}
review:
[b]Disclaimer:[/b] I bought this game for $0.79 during a sale. My review is based on paying this price. If you look to pay significantly more or less for this game, my view point doesn't apply to you as much. 

[b]Summary: [/b] Cosmic DJ is a music game that require zero musical experience. The player gets to "create" music using one very simple tool. To spice things up some, there is a bit of a story driven single player mode that doesn't take itself seriously at all. It managed to get some laughs out of me, but it's silly humor probably isn't for everyone. The game only took me a couple of hours to beat. Apart from the story missions, you can just freely use the music creation tool and everything you do in the game can be exported to MP3s if yuou just have to share with your friends. 

[b] The Good: [/b] Cosmic DJ does an amazing job of setting a mood and sticking with it. I quickly learned that the game wanted me to laugh and have fun the whole time and it succeeded in doing such. Knowing absolutely nothing about music will not stop you from enjoying this game. Soundtrack was pretty damn good :D

[b] The Not so Good: [/b] While you can switch the creation tool into "grid mode" there is very little customization happening. For people who are familiar with music, you get to edit rythym down to sixteenth notes, but the actual notes are locked into 4 tones for every song. I understand that this is to make it easy for everyone, but I felt like I was missing out on some really cool stuff because of how limited I was. It seems like just a little bit of work could really turn that around. 

[b] The Verdict [/b]: 7/10 -3 for lack of depth. I felt like Cosmic DJ could have really impressed me and drawn me in for a few more hours but missed the mark. But, for $0.79, it's hard to go wrong with Cosmic DJ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111397167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1451408227}
review:
das spiel ermöglicht einen einblick für nicht-musiker in das genre.
ein sequenzer der 2 takte umfasst und live eingespielt werden kann
und auch in einem raster programmiert werden kann.
die instrumente werden per zufall ausgewählt und alles ist simpel gehalten.
aber eine schöne spielerei, die zeigen kann ob man interesse haben könnte
ernsthafte programme oder musikhardware zu kaufen.
der preis ist gering. es ist für kinder geeignet.
es ist kein spiel dem man es recht machen muss indem man immer besser wird...
...man kann gute oder schlechte musik damit machen, das ligt am spieler.
es ist als spiel verpackt um menschen dafür zu interessieren, die niemals ihre zeit an
einem softwaresequenzer verbringen würden um zu lernen wie er benutzt wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121316371', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1572259142}
review:
作为一款3刀的游戏还是挺不错的w这游戏是系统给个底的伴奏，然后玩家利用五种音色的声音创作乐曲。
创作有两种模式，一种是玩家跟随节奏直接鼓点敲击（介绍图中黄色的圆盘），另一种是倒数第二张图里那种直接按谱子来的。
每一关都有一段小剧情，声音的选择和剧情有点关系【
每关是要自制四段音乐，音符量达到一定数量即可过关，对曲调没任何限制。导出的时候系统会把这四段拼一起，加头尾，中间会加点花。可以自绘专辑封面。

优点：
价格低廉
自制音乐可导出
界面效果好
一种声音半天没创作完系统会给一种可替换的声音

缺点：
新手导引有点欠缺，我还以为是要和背景乐音重合之类的。。。后来发现随便编曲就好。
作底的伴奏好像是八小节，不过玩家只能编辑四小节的音乐，有点短。【大概是四小节。。。音乐知识不足可能有倍数错误
每种声音只有四个音阶可以选，对于钢琴类的来说稍微有点少，鼓点类的还好。

总的来说游戏还不错w喜欢自己编编音乐玩的可以尝试下这个游戏w

author: {'steamid': '76561198002547996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1434455117}
review:
音色を選んでリズムに合わせて8小節分だけぽちぽちする。
ゲームに難易度はないようなもので、適当にぽちぽちすればクリアできる。ちょっとリズムミスっても後から編集可能。
適当に音色を選んでいってぽちぽちすると曲っぽくなっていってステージクリアとなる。これを4回繰り返す。
最後にジャケットをデザインして曲名を付けてエキスポート！オリジナル曲できた！
作った4つの4小節は自動でミックスされてすごいまともな1分ちょっとの曲になる。すごい！
縛りがほぼない音ゲーをすると音ゲーっぽい曲ができるようなゲーム！楽しい！
POWER OF THE MUSIC!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043918172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1502655486}
review: I just bought this game and already beat it and then replayed it, it's cheap, short, and fun and I love the humor and design! I agree with other reviewers that it's more a toy than a game with a real objective, but I think as long as you know you're going into it to just mess around and make simple tunes then that isn't a problem. Only issue for me was you can't save the jams you make in the final level, the music there was my favorite and I was really disappointed that I wasn't given the opportunity to save anything. Also the flashing lights definitely means this isn't built for anyone with photosensitivity/epilepsy, I'm usually fine and I had to cover my eyes a few times myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030080035', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1433373675}
review:
En un primer momento, el juego es Caos. No sabes muy bien que hay que hacer, sobre todo si como yo, no miras guias ni nada antes de jugar y te gusta ir descubriendo.
Luego te encuentras en un mundo de música electrónica que vas realizando por capas con 4 notas y 8 tiempos y muchas luces brillantes y de colores que darían epilepsia al 80% de la población.
Y... eso es lo que lo hace tan atractivo, las capas, aunque aporrees al azar se montan perfectamente, y siempre acabas con una música cañera y un pequeño videoclip que puedes guardar en mp3!.
Al final, es lo que es, un juego de creación de música electrónica dentro de una pequeña historia en la cual avanzas gracias al Poder de la Música.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091903745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1433295857}
review: Cosmic DJ is short music game. Create beats and get rid of the dude with the bad vibes. It's quite short, but fun to play, create your own beats, you can save these during the came. You can then listen to them on your mp3 player. Good fun for 1-2 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058315102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1555694507}
review:
Если вы когда то мечтали создовать музыку, ну что то вам мешало, например языковой барьер, сложность программ, плохая фантазия или же не хватало времени???
Cosmic DJ хорошее решение ваших проблем, тут как говорится:
быстро
весело
качественно
не стыдно показать друзьям
и просто интересный сюжет
Единственная проблема-это английский язык, ну тут можно сказать он на уровне 4 класса. Всё просто и понятно!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198197547379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1434124269}
review: This game is incredible, I have no regrets on purchasing this. It's an incredibly entertaining game where you can create your own music for individual stories, such as helping a corgi get his jetpack back, or uniting two people. After the story has finished, the game auto saves your songs and puts them all into one mp3 which is saved to your computer. You don't need to be good at making music to enjoy this entertaining game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135041155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1442620665}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006541362', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1432990679}
review:
Cosmic DJ is, all things considered, indeed more of a toy than a proper game but it's a pretty fun one.
As the titular protagonist, your task is to help people and fight bad vibes by filling a bar, you do so adding instruments to the track that's playing thus creating your own songs.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-while extremely simple,the gameplay is very fun

-nonsensical yet entertaining story

-top notch sound (created by you aswell)

-good amount of different instruments

-intuitive controls,whether tapping or using a grid it's easy to choose instruments,their tone and when they'd appear

-charming graphics, they're simple overall but there's nice little touches, like the various instruments changing the scene whenever they're active during the track

-good sense of humour through the whole game

[b]CONS:[/b]

-very simple gameplay, you can just click randomly and win, if you're so inclined

-very short, if you try and make some decent music it'd take you about an hour and a half

-screen flashing is sometimes overdone

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=450843453

Overall I found Cosmic DJ to be a fun albeit limited game: creating your tracks is an interesting experience and it surely tickled my creative side while the funny story was enough to carry the game through its duration.
For 80 cents on sale I think this'd be an interesting experience for most people, even more so if you're interested in music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018883340', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1432968201}
review:
Well, there is no actual game. You just mash as much buttons as possible to pass a level.
And the pretty graphics and sound... They get boring in less than a minute.

I had more fun losing four times the price I paid for this program to a scammer using an item that was similar to another of a higher price. He was very smart and I was having so much profit that I really did not mind losing a little to remind myself to always be safe even if it is not a lot of money.

Mistakes, errors, mess ups... Make them at a micro scale to get it right at the bigger ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070053122', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1449710394}
review:
I had tons of fun with this game. Even at full retail price, I'd recommend this game. My only real issue about this game is that it's short- it's VERY short. It only took me 1 hour to finish the story line- which wasn't really much of one. Cosmic DJ is a game where you are a Cosmic DJ and have to save the city from "Bad Vibes" from the main antagonist (forgot his name). The antagonist destroys all the "Jamtennas" that provide good vibes to the city. As the cosmic DJ, you must fix these "Jamtennas" by completing the tasks given. There are 4 Jamtennas you must fix and each Jamtenna offers 4-5 missions where you need to create a song using the tools given and fix the Jamtenna. The gameplay is very fun and energetic. It's not really complicated and can easily be done by a child. One thing I really liked about the game is that after you create your song, the game will mix all of the songs from that one Jamtenna into a remix which you can save as a .mp3 to your computer. You can create cover art while the game converts the remix into a .mp3. You aren't forced to save the songs, if you really don't like it. 

Conclusion: If you are hesitant on getting this game, buy it. It's cheap, fun, and will kill time if you need to. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198128522820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1433046096}
review: Super unique interactive digital distraction. It's not really a music maker, not a game, really. It's simple, yet more creatively inspiring than most games in my library. Super cheap and incredibly fun, Cosmic DJ oozes with value. Don't be deterred by the "casual" tag; Cosmic DJ is simple to play but deep with fun. You have no excuse to miss this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035358786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1593737920}
review:
Cosmic DJ is less of a game and more of a toybox.  By simply pressing four keys at different intervals, you can generate simple 2-measure sequences of electronic music in 4/4.  It sounds basic, but with its variety of different instruments (drum kits, synthesizers, vocoders, odd samples, and many others), grid-based editing, and post-play remixes, anyone can make a song that can range anywhere between decent to amazing.  

The presentation style is absurd and comical.  The vivid colors, animations, and effects can probably be described better by video gameplay rather than this review.  I found the dialogue to be humorous, but could be considered strange or obnoxious.  

I wouldn't recommend this to a general audience, but it does have a very strong recommendation to anyone who likes electronic music, unique atmospheres, or just something completely different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047212251', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1673927020}
review: For such a cheap game, Cosmic DJ really delivers. Even the tutorial had me bopping my head to the beat I created! All you have to do is put different sound effects in at a choice of 4 separate notes. Although 4 isn't much in retrospect, it didn't seem like I had fewer options, rather it seemed like the whole thing was simpler. There's also the added bonus of re-playing the same level many times and making completely different beats each time through. There are several songs you must apply beats to, and at the end of every level it combines all the songs into one *cosmic jam* for you to listen to! The story is light and doesn't get too deep into anything, and always manages to have a little humor sprinkled here and there. This game is perfect for those wanting to have fun with music, and get really creative/funky with it at the same time.

review: This is a weird....thing,I really cant call it a game.Its more like an interactive ringtone maker with sounds like they are from cell phones but and i beat the whole thing in 30 minutes and i did try not just spam buttons.This is a fun little time tho but i cant really recomend it.The idea basically is beat back the bad jams by making your own good vibes,which you can then save and export which is a really cool idea but again they all sound like those ringtones you could make on a cell phone.I will admit that they do sound better than those.If you want to spend 30 minutes making your own mp3s or like a weird little story that is fun honestly then buy it,but the gameplay isnt worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198142235524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1427624782}
review:
3/5
Make a 30 sec song.

Cosmic DJ is a very simple drum/midi machine.  The game gives you 4 instuments, and you place the pre-determined 4 notes/sounds from each instrument into the 2 measure play area (or play along with the keyboard).  Once finished, the computer cuts your parts up so it sounds like 2 different parts.  Then is saves your song. 

Thats' the whole game.  One mode has a little bit of story, while the other mode lets you randomly pick instruments to compose with. 

This game would be better if you could browse the instruments or even lengthen your track; but it should be a fun way for kids to learn how to make beats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118715', 'num_games_owned': 4134, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1427266835}
review:
キッチュなテクノサウンドがかかれば山手線は宇宙を駆けるし
ポテト(コーギィ犬・雄)の生首に胴体だって見つけてやれる

物が物だけに曲作りに行き詰まったアーティストが服用しがちな
特別なおクスリでもキメて話書いたんじゃないかと思いたくもなる
音楽の力であらゆるトラブルをどうにかするカジュアル作曲ゲー

自分の好きなタイミングでZXCV、4つのキーをぽちぽち押すだけで
選んだ楽器によって4種の音階ないし音色が鳴り、わずか8小節を
数種のパートで賑やかにしていくだけでなんとなく解決した気分に

そんなことを3～4回繰り返すとエピソードクリアで、最後にそこで
作った素材を繋ぎ合わせて1分20秒の曲をでっち上げてくれる
ご丁寧にジャケット画像まで作れて、それを埋め込んだMP3形式で
吐き出す機能までついてるっていう至れり尽くせりな仕様


というかこれ実際のとこはゲームの振りをしてハードルを下げた
DTM作曲体験ソフトっていうのが正しいんじゃなかろうか
ゲームとしては客が盛り上がる成否の基準がまったくわからない
多分あいつら1秒間に2回以上音が鳴ってれば喜ぶ

review: Personally, this game just didnt "get" me. It has a very nice and well done UI, the point of the game is to create musical beats pretty much. Although I'm musical myself, I didn't really find this game all that fun. The challenges ask you to create a music beat to move on, but really you can just hit any random note and you will pass with ease. It has about 100 minutes of gameplay, although if you actually 'try' you could get a bit more time out of it. Maybe others will enjoy this, but it just didn't turn out to be my sort of game. 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996327156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1424225719}
review:
Just download a free step sequencer like Hydrogen.

Note that although cheap, this game has only about a hundred minutes of gameplay. It doesn't offer a particularly featureful or powerful step sequencer. I doubt I'll touch it again.

This is a gamified tutorial for using a step sequencer. If the game was far longer and introduced more and more features from major step sequencers and itself had a fully featured one built in, it'd be better. It'd be nice if you could reach the point where this produces results similar to what you can achieve with something like Hydrogen. As it is though, there are only a few builtin song structures, your sequences are limited to 8 bars, and there is no kind of song editor nor any kind of automation for mixing or effects.

The content of this game is pretty much clean, so it might be good if you have kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968651653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1423112254}
review:
Yo! I heard you like dope beats and cosmic good times, maaaan! ;)

Ingredients: One part space, Two parts good times and a bucket-load of electronic music creation!
Jammin' to great tunes that you can customize and even export into mp3 files yourself! This game is a fun environment to get the first taste of what it's like when you wanna become an electronic music producer. Tap on the keyboard to play instruments or use the grid-sequencer to make outta this world jams! Then take them to the party that's on a cosmic scale!!! Good times ensured, drugs not included!

Pros: Made me remember what its like to make jams kicking of the a** on my midi-keyboard! OH sh**! I'm gonna go make more awesome tracks now in [electronic music producer program] !!! Thanks Cosmic DJ! :) <3 <3 <3
Cons: I WISH it was longer... Maybe DLC please?

author: {'steamid': '76561198004207026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1422955373}
review:
音楽を作曲していろいろなクエストを攻略する
サイケデリックなグラフィックのゲーム。

作曲と言っても与えられた数種類の楽器を
キーを押したりマウスクリックで音を配置して
8小節埋めればOK。難しくはない。やり直しも簡単。
1ステージで4曲程度作ったらクリア。大体15分くらい。
キャンペーンモード以外に20秒前後の単発の曲を
自由に作れるモードもあり、気軽に楽しめる。

楽器のボリュームはそれぞれ調整できるが
パンは設定不可なのが惜しいところ。
ある程度適当に作って音がずれてたりしても
ゲームの中の人がカッコよくEDITしてくれて
そこそこ出来のいいモノが出来上がる。

作った曲は保存してあとで聴く事もできるし、
MP3ファイルに変換して出力できる。

デフォ値298円の割には結構楽しめる。
DTMとか敷居が高いけど手軽に作曲したい
というような人にオススメしたいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198059560324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1675144521}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048203954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1422705058}
review:
Drogas.... Drogas duras..... Es como fumarse un porro de 1 kilo de maria aliñado un un poco de droja del colacao.
Tendrás que llevar a cabo tareas surrealistas al ritmo de una música que tu mismo irás modificando, sin saber cómo ni porqué pasaras de una pantalla a otra enganchado, creo yo, que por la extraña sensación que consigue la musica con las mierdas hipnóticas que irán apareciendo en pantalla.
Cuando te levantes de la silla andarás como drogado por culpa de este juego, te derrite un poco el cerebro por lo absurdo que es, pero aun asi mola, es dificil de explicar pero mola.
Es muy corto, pero creo que eso me ha salvado de perder la cabeza por compreto, la banda sonora es realmente pegadiza.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135752434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1462488809}
review: Although not an actual dj software, Cosmic DJ is a fun and innovative way to introduce people to a different aspect of music. The creativity allows for players to customize a jam that they like. This is where the review turns sweet-n-sour; when making a jam and recording the track, you get no say as to how the track is made: you can sequence the basic sounds and stuff, but can't arrange what, where, and how your sequences go into the track, which sort of sucks from a music making perspective. The storyline is somewhat cheesy, with many uses of hippy terminology such as "maaaaaaan" (feel free to add or subtract any number of a's), but it adds to the atmosphere, or "vibes", of the game. Then there's the overly corny theme that everything can be resloved through, and I quote, "THE POWER OF MUSIC!!!!". It's a fun and creative game, not intended for hardcore music producers, or people into deep, serious storylines. If you're into creating/listening to music and corny shenanigans, you might want to check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028844912', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1419683317}
review:
What can I say. I have only play this for an hour and I am already in Love.
The game is simple and fun. It allows you to create some wicked music.
And the best part is you can export your music to mp3 and hence share with others your musical creation.
I highly recommened this to everyone. Would be great introduction to making your own music to kids due to its simple
and entertaining story.
Pros: Cheap and worth the money.
         Entertaining story
         Simple interface
         Fun to play.
         Reminds me of my old Amiga Sound tracker days.
I can't yet think of any cons.
This game has heaps of potential, hope they make a sequal with additional features.
Thankyou devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064583296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1449586805}
review:
遊戲約五到六個關卡而已，算是小品遊戲
畫面相當華麗，簡單的線條及動畫，算是有搭上氣氛
不懂基本樂理無所謂，只要有點節奏感即可。
我想不管是誰都可以混出不錯的旋律。
美中不足的是，軟體附有匯出成mp3的功能，
但可惜的是並不能完整取出, 它是把你混出的音加到固定的主旋律上
所以在聽的時後會覺得都很像。但以這個價格來說，算是相當值得購買的。

author: {'steamid': '76561197994830200', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1417114467}
review: As others have said, not much of an actual game here. It seems like a flash mix-board with some funny visuals. The game has you select one of the pre-determined instruments, hit buttons however you like, click on one of the remaining instruments. Repeat until a meter is filled and you've won? It does output an MP3 mix at the end of each level based on how you sequenced, which is a little bonus, but don't expect to make actual music with this. It's basically the freestyle sections of Rock Band with weird visuals and a "wacky" story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001293611', 'num_games_owned': 1574, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1402767306}
review:
Game? No this is more like a... "Simple DJ Beat Making Game"

As far as that goes, it's FUN!... if short lived.

You'll explore all the game has to offer in... well an hour as you can see my time with it.

BUT DON"T LET THAT STOP YOU from getting it, If you loved how Amplitude or Fequency from PS2 was fun and let you mess with songs, then this is another one you may like.

MY ONLY WISH: if they would let me make my own mix of items to play with, rather than just the random or the story options, that and maybe let the community make sounds and have them make stages for the game/tool.

review: This is one of the weirdest things I've played in a while. Basically you just toss together some sequencer songs to go with a funky story about love, robots, and body-less space dogs. It tells you that you're the best and by the end you've made a little album. I really can't fault it for being exactly what it is and it does kind of share the joy of creating music (no actual talent required).

author: {'steamid': '76561198118371170', 'num_games_owned': 7082, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1417795455}
review:
A strange little game that reminds me of an old Casio keyboard I played with when I was a kid.  I didnt really make 'real' music, except in my head.  Here too...  I think a real musician could probably make something of this, but I can at least pretend I am DJ Batman for a little while -_-

As to the plot, I think it is over the top silly, and it is a 'charming' feature of the game.  It definitely doesnt take itself seriously, and that is good.

I got this with a half off coupon and I think if you can get it in a bundle or for ~1-2$US then you are going to have a nice little distraction.  6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983850432', 'num_games_owned': 1552, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1416172936}
review:

But enough about me. 

This game is a big surprise.  Buy it if you want to try a music-based game that is much more involved and well thought than Rock Band.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068511460', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1417559308}
review:
Wow.
In short, the game'll only take about an hour to finish, but that single hour was more fun than most games can offer in the same amount of time. It does right on the mistake so many simple games falter on; it doesn't overstay it's welcome. It's constantly moving, completely crazy, and I really enjoyed it.

Buy it on a sale, and make some sweet jams.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079017859', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1555799303}
review:
Note: This is not really a game. It's a toy. An awesome toy that you should buy and play with. You literally cannot lose. 

Have you ever dreamed of being a DJ? Playing with all those buttons with labels on them that say "SAMPLE" and making awesome music happen, like magic shooting out of your fingers? How about a DJ in space? And also the DJ is on LSD?

Sorry, I lost my train of thought. Too busy trying to put this corgi back together with my sweet beats.

Just... Just buy it. You will not regret it. And if you do regret it, you're not someone I ever want to hang out with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054539340', 'num_games_owned': 1819, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1416177893}
review:
Now, there are a great many things I could say about this game (whether or not this falls under the definition of game is at the reader's discretion, however). "Amazing", "fantastic", or similar remarks do not quite encompass the sheer excellence of this software. Many would find it to appear as some sort of cheap, down-modelled sequencer - but underneath the shell of STEVE-3's sly wit, a story is told. Of what? you ask.

Why not purchase the game and find out?

author: {'steamid': '76561198022820771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1416023899}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YakGOZLU6aY&list=UU7_-PLIhjsEBwIQXqKxmNpA

	Cosmic DJ is a musical, rhythmic gaming experience.  The story is kooky,
but irrelevant.  The game is about building and creating your own music. There
isn't a score system, and no real failure state; instead the game is about laying
down a "sick" beat and melody.  You are limited to what tones are provided to you,
which limits  the player from creating something truly unique to the player.  It
missed the mark a bit there, because the mechanics to provide this are there, they
just don't allow more freedom to the player.

	One fun feature is the availability to use the music any way you want, with
no copyright issues, you can download it onto your computer to listen to at your
leisure.  For the price point, this game is easy to recommend.  It is simplistic
yet goofy and fun, even if its a little short.

This is a summary of my review video, which I encourage you to 
watch if you are looking for a more in-depth review. 

Thanks for your viewership and support; for more videos check click here.

http://www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

author: {'steamid': '76561198025049339', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1416068044}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007109238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1582578738}
review:
В это игре вы становитесь легендарным космическим диджеем и ваша задача делать музыку пока игры обрушивает на вас шквалы наркоманских изображений.

В игре шикарная музыка и забавная история. Если в кратце то вы должны спасти космос импользуя  THE POWER OF MUSIC!

Правда в это игре вы не совсем делаете музыку, вы скорее делаете ремиксы уже существующей музыки. Но вы все таки не легендарный космический музыкант а легендарный космический диджей.

Игра очень короткая но я не пожалел ни копейки пока её проходил, это хороший заряд позитива.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138082110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1415990190}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970479670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1507332010}
review: Do you got rhythm and style?  Cosmic DJ will show you that you do, with no shortage of fun visuals.  Great game for kids and adults alike.  About the only downside of it is that you'll have it finished inside of an hour, but then you can always go back and jam again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981706607', 'num_games_owned': 4148, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1415828577}
review:
It's a Music Synthesizer loosely disguised as a game.  It doesn't give you a huge amount of freedom, but that also means that just about anything you put together in it wil come out at least decent. You can export your tracks out as MP3s, which is cool - I've got a couple I built out of Cosmic DJ in my always-around collection.
The humor and graphics are off-the-wall insane, which only adds to the off-beat feel.  If you can deal with dogs on skateboards and healing marriages with the Power of Music, you should be right at home here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025201425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1429939672}
review:
It's not a long game, but if you're willing to actually play along instead of mashing buttons to fill the bar, you can get some fun little tunes. It's sort of like playing with one of those big Casio keyboards that has a bunch of instrument sounds and premade rhythms programmed into it, if you've ever done that, but with bonus rave-bright visuals and some options for putting together your very own MS Paint-style cover art.

It's cute, it's fun, and it won't set you back much, so check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066214623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1432933115}
review:
1. Vibrant Psychedelic Art Direction
2. Catchy Electro Music 
3. Lasers, Rainbows, Cosmos, and Beats!
4. Good Vibes

S Y N O P S I S:
Cosmic DJ is a short romp through a wild story about keeping the good vibes flowing through electronic music. Its gameplay revolves around 'jamming' to a preset back track and layering instruments and melodies to move onto the next stage. Don't expect much flexibility in terms of music creation. All the tracks are set to a specific key signature, measure, and tempo. There is also a limited number of instruments to play with for each track; all of which are set to a specific chord progression. These limitations, however, don't detract from the simple fun of jamming along and freestyling the sequence of melodies and instruments. The story is humorous and engaging enough for players to plow through the short 1 hour plot (give or take a few minutes depending on how much the player extends each jam session). Some players may think this is too short without enough content. I'd say that the length of the game is appropriate for the context of this title. The experience will leave a smile on your face once it's through and you'll wish there was more. Luckily, there is some replayability in a Quickplay mode that lets you choose sets of instruments to jam with and create new tunes. One of the best features of the game is its ability to export your jam sessions to MP3s, complete with cover art that you make within the game itself, using the various crazy visuals and stickers they provide. All in all, this is a great indie title for anyone who enjoys rhythm games and quirky, offbeat humor with pop art visuals. Give it a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017543849', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1407457263}
review:
This game is short, sweet, and for those itching to make a quick beat. 

Gameplay wise, this game will have you dishing out beats using many different instruments. I find it delightful when I make a beat that just sounds pretty damn good, and if you enjoy what you made, you have the option to save the music so you can listen to it later. Also, the number of levels are few, but each are fun and offer a unique style that would most likely intrigue you, whether it be the rocket corgis or the flailing puppets.

Moving on to what I have to say about the graphics, I must say, they are charming and I enjoy the retro feel of it all. The game is bright and colorful, and the levels offer different styles to keep things wacky and strange, which I enjoy about this game. It's quirkiness and humor is enjoyable.

The audio, oh, the audio. Being that this is a rhythm game, the music features catchy techno tunes that will have you bobbing your head as you create your music. Also, the narrator, a funky shaped fellow, has an... how should I say... enticing voice.

Overall, this is a game that should be played if you enjoy music, want to create it, and want to experience the quirky world that is Cosmic DJ. Considering the low price, this game is well worth trying.

[spoiler] Fly, rocket corgi, fly! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198045758250', 'num_games_owned': 1082, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1575726791}
review:
Don't expect very much flexibility in what and how you can create music, and it doesn't even matter because this game is much more about jamming than about fiddling with controls, applying 2xLP filters and trying to make 1/12th notes. (If you actually expect to make your own music maybe you should be looking for a DAW or some actual sequencer software instead.) Cosmic DJ comes with some really good and groovy baseline beats that you can jam along to, and it's a lot of good old casual fun. Highly recommended if you need a musical break from the more conventional games or just want to chill out and mess around a little.

Actually, I imagine this game could do pretty well hooked up to a good stereo and a projector at a party. People can jam along no matter how tone deaf they think they are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063369806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1412544799}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146396', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 2129, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1704147990}
review:
КАК НАСЧЁТ СРАЗИТЬСЯ СО ЗЛОДЕЕМ, ПРИ ПОМОЩИ "THE POWER OF MUUUUUSIC!!1"?

Сюжет - примитив, но графика - конфетка, а весь геймплей - создание собственного хита игроком через секвенсер. Да-да, вы не очитались! Запускаем игру, проходим уровень и вауаля!,- становимся великолепнейшим COSMIC DJ! Лично я сразу же залил во ВК свои творения и с удовольствием их переслушиваю.

Игра заканчивается быстро, но в то же время - как раз в тот момент, когда считаешь: "Все, мне хватит, я наелся". На повторное прохождение игра не тянет, зато пройдя её один раз от начала до конца, человек, который всё-таки дружит с понятием "мелодичность", будет ещё долго вспоминать момент создания своих хитов, иногда их переслушивая из своей фонотеки.

Музыкальным личностям - играть обязательно! Ну, если понятие "играть" применимо к игре - проиграть в ней невозможно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095315749', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1485580154}
review: I recomend this game IF you are ready for a really short story line. There are honestly something like 6 levels. also the level difficulty can be beat by a cat on a keyboard. ANY WAY, this game has some great features like-the levels are not the main part of the game, the music is, you can make music after the levels and save them to your com. AND the story line is short but really funny. the narrator is hilarious and the levels have some what imature but funny graphics. if you actually put time in to making some good music then it will work. some of the bad reviews are based on the fact that 1. the music sounds bad 2. the levels have no challenge. Both of these are true if you SUCK AT IT. yes the levels are easy but you are missing the point of the game. you negetive people spam the z x c v buttons while the more talented people who try to make good music actually use the board in which you can make proper notes. the game is fun and quirky and i would recomend it to people under 18. (maybe under 16).

author: {'steamid': '76561198135944203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1409753198}
review:
Normalmente suelo hacer análisis a los juegos luego de pasar mas de 10H con el pero este hace la excepción, tan solo 2 horas jugadas ya que esa es la duración del Juego XD pero sin mas introductorios doy una idea de lo que va este fantástico y corto juego.

Cosmic DJ es un juego totalmente alocado lleno de música electrónica, muchos colores (Me pregunto que efectos podría ocasionar este juego con una persona drogada) , en el tomas el rol del legendario DJ Cósmico que junto a su talento musical va en compañía de STEVE3 se remontan a una aventura con el objetivo de salvar el universo WITH THE POWER OF MUSIC! a través de distintas historias (Que por cierto, cada una tiene un montón de cosas sin sentido) pero a la vez son jodidamente divertidas.

En definitiva, es un juego que te hará reír y disfrutar con todas las rolas que puedes crear mientras salvas el Universo, yo lo recomiendo altamente para pasar una noche un poco diferente, a pesar de lo corto que es,  realmente es muy divertido, aun asi, sigue siendo un poco caro para lo que ofrece, si lo puedes conseguir a cambio de unos cromos ve a por el y ya.

¿Que esperas? 

GO TO SAVE THE UNIVERSE WITH THE POWER OF MUSIC!

review:
2/10 bears if you hate music games.

The bear scale:

< 2 It's crap don't waste your time
2-5 It's below what a bear standard would be.
5-7 It's good, might be a thing in there that's above industry standard
7-9 You will probably enjoy, you should buy this to support the developer
9+ GOTY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE THIS THEN YOU'RE MISSING OUT

DO YOU LIKE RHYTHM GAEMS?
DO YOU TRUST MY REVIEWS?

SHIT YES YOU DO, WHY ELSE WOULD YOU BE READING THIS SHIT.

THIS GAME IS ABOUT SOMEONE STEALING THE POWER OF MUSIC, YOU HAVE YOUR 1980's SYNTHESIZER AND HAVE TO BRING  DEFEAT THE BAD VIBES WITH

THIS IS LIKE KINDA DDR AND SHIT, IT'S GOOD I GOT IT IN A HUMBLE BUNDLE, BRETTY GUD BUT IT SEAMS I CAN JUST SPAM MY MOUSE AND WIN, SO TREAT IT AS A COMFY GAME FOR YOUR FATASS.

WOULD BUY IT IF I LIKED MUSIC GAMES, HELL YOU PROBABLY BROUGHT INTO GUITAR HERO, SO WHY NOT BUY IN TO THIS?

BUY IT OR NOT, IDGAF. PEOPLE SPEND $80 ON COD, THAT'S LIKE 8 COPIES OF THIS BITCH FOR YOU AND YOUR M8's TO JAM OUT AND SUCK EACH OTHERS SYNTH'S.

IF THERE WAS MORE SKILL TO IT I WOULD RECOMMEND HIGHLY, BUT NOW I ONLY RECOMMEND IF YOU LIKE MUSIC GAMES, LIKE BEATTRIP BEAT.ETC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044839188', 'num_games_owned': 3384, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1408538554}
review:
http://youtu.be/o4GJz7wrkPQ

To nie jest coś, co zakupisz świadomie. Będzie na Ciebie czyhać, na piątkowy póxny wieczór, kiedy zanurzony w absurdzie będziesz przeglądać półki Steamowe. Roztoczy wokół Ciebie czar niepoprawnej prezentacji odbijając kalką obrazy niepokojące tuż przed Twoimi oczami. Zaintryguje, pozwoli się przedstawić na szeregu obrazków. Wryje Ci się w podświadomość na tyle, że kolejnego piątku może nie być ucieczki.

Wierzcie lub nie, bawiłem się wybornie.

Gdyby przełożyć totalną abstrakcję na zerojedynkowe szaleństwo, nie widziałem lepszej. Wy też. I bardzo krótko, ale szalałem za konsolą DJa przednio. Zaraz też będziecie. Press play.

BAWIMY SIĘ INTERNETY!

http://youtu.be/o4GJz7wrkPQ

http://www.gikz.pl/artykuly/pierwsze-wrazenia/mocny-trip-cosmic-dj/

author: {'steamid': '76561198030482420', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1424541033}
review:
Eines der besten Spiele aller Universen vereint! Als Cosmic DJ hat man die Fähigkeiten den Kosmos zu manipulieren und somit Musik zu erzeugen, die man mit mit seinen Cosmic DJ skills zu sweeten Jams erweitert. 
Ein Spielspaß für jung und alt, da man auf Grund seines Mentors im Spiel "Steve3" sicher und ohne Irrwege mit dem Spielprinzip vertraut gemacht wird.

Sei der Cosmic DJ <3

review: It's a quirky, fun, and goofy music creation tool. The "game" portion can be beaten by slamming your face into the keyboard for about 40 minutes, but trust me this is well worth the money. One of the best Early Access purchases I've made hands down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120898742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1407584244}
review:
Fajna mieszanka kreatora muzyki (ustawiasz kiedy sample mają grać) i Gry. W dodatku twoje dzieło automatycznie miksuje (nawet brzmi to jako tako jeżeli stworzyłeś coś na kształt kakofonii) i możesz wyeksportować do MP3.  Ale kampania jest bardzo krótka (tylko 5 poziomów) i można ją przejść naciskając/nawalając losowo w przyciski. 2 tryby sampli: Ręczny (Dobry) i przyciskowy (Do kitu).
Nie wygląda na to żeby ta gra wyglądała na "Wstępny dostęp".

author: {'steamid': '76561198048284656', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1514944057}
review:
La verdad que estoy sin palabras para este Juego ; lo único que puedo decir : 

-THE POWER OF MUSICCCCCCCCCC !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Mega Super Épico , espero que lo mejoren en 1 futuro con total libertad de customizacion tal cual quieren hacer , pero aun asi tal cual esta , lo Borda 10/10 .

author: {'steamid': '76561197963164050', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1441994617}
review: Cosmic DJ is a small game to train your feeling about rhythm, sounds and melodies. It's rather short, but very enjoyable and fun to play. It has a high replayability value and allows you to save your songs and share them with others. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972272404', 'num_games_owned': 2782, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1407356590}
review:
I'm not sure when or for how much I bought this game, but my assumption was it was a daily deal and it was for 1-2$. I recently installed it and thought I'd give it a whirl. The game does a great job at ensuring it makes fun of itself, is entertaining while still being corny and has decent rhythm mechanics to actually make it fun gameplay wise.

While it wasn't hard to beat, and took less than an hour, it was definitely a blast to try all the different musical options, tap vs. pad & also see all the zany scenarios & visuals that the creators dreamed up to compliment the rhythm game.

If you have a free hour and want to go through a very weird space DJ odyssey (filled with colorful and crazy visuals, a very random story and some fun music) then this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041826047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1411482434}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001554018', 'num_games_owned': 1475, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1440090274}
review: Nice game. It's cool when you realize, you can export your own track from the game. It's like an FL Studio for kids. :D That CORGI stuff is the weirdest thing I can ever imagine in an indie game like this. CORGI for ever!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089691722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1407624472}
review:
Bought this on a Humble Bundle thinking it might something cool to check out, and was not dissapointed. Had a lot of fun with this one, and may even try to bring it out a party or something to see if it can be even more fun with friends.

It's certainly not for making real music, but I did find my self head bobbing quite a lot while playing this and really getting into the beat to make my tunes. The product of most the songs was fun to listen to at best but not something I'd rock out to in my car or a dance club.

Take this as what it is, a fun game, and a good time while playing it. If you can find it cheap like I did then give it a try.

DON'T PLAY THIS, EVEN IF YOU BOUGHT IT FROM HUMBLE BUNDLE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047656247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1407292928}
review: don't be fooled into thinking that this is a rhythm game - the whole experience is designed to allow non-musically inclined individuals like myself to create engaging audio-visual experiences without very much trouble at all. There's no real failure in the game aside from failing to meet your own expectations and produce a song that you don't find enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058687420', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1446504170}
review:
A perfectly executed source of pure fun!

It's hard to explain why I am still so in love with this little game/toybox, because it doesn't sound like much. Basically, imagine a tiny music sequencer, simplify it until a three year old can use it, populate it with a weird and weirdly entertaining collection of samples (dog-bark syntesizers anyone?), add some fascinatingly odd visuals and a trippy story, mix it all up with acid and make the head of an utterly crazy yet completely adorable corgi drive it into space. Get the idea? No? I don't blame you, I wouldn't have believed that this could possibly work as a game either.

The campaign is admittedly very short but makes up for it by offering you one of the most ridiculously awesome stories you could have never imagined. And after you've recovered from that experience, you're still left with the quick play, a super simplified but surprisingly fun little sequencer that is there for you every time you need a 15-minute boost of joy in your day. If you like the idea of fiddling with music and beats, even if you've never tried anything like this before, you need to give this little marvel a go. Fear not your musical incompetence, I am persuaded that the game is rigged to make whatever odd things you create sound brilliant despite your worse efforts.

Cosmic DJ is not a game, it is the perfect cheer-me-up machine, the cheapest happy pill on the market. For some strange reason I have a stupid smile plastered on my face every time I fire it up, and every time without exception I feel like hugging the devs afterwards. If it also gave me the munchies I'd be surprised it was legal. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079386093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1407315978}

review: Not saying the game is terrible, but I have no real idea what the point of this game is. The game forces you to overlay so many beats on top of each other, and sometimes the selected instruments sound horrible together. But put enough instruments in, tap z, x, c and v enough times and you win. No real game here. Just a giant, super simple mix board.
