review: Obvioulsy this is a music game. Nonetheless, this game gives you the POWER OF MUSIC via sampling to restore the cosmic balance of good vibes for a rockin' party. Go on an epic quest of makin' your own beats n' licks and find your inner Cosmic DJ. Or corgi. Same thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051370888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1407273790}
review: Thank you. I cried.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040996621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1612822426}
review:
Pour comencer, le "mode histoire" est extrêmement court et ne propose aucun challenge, si ce n'est celui de créer quelque chose d'audible (subjectivement) avec les instruments à notre disposition. Mais le scénario et l'ambiance complètement barrés donnent une vraie âme à ce jeu. Encore une fois, dommage que ça soit aussi court!
Le mode "quick play" nous permet de créer des morceaux hors du scénario, pour notre plaisir. On a à disposition toujours 5 instruments qui se proposent à nous de manière aléatoire - on peut en changer, aléatoirement, autant de fois qu'on veut avant de commencer - à nous ensuite de mettre en forme. Ici encore : à mon sens c'est trop limité. Surtout que le jeu possède un "recorder" automatique, qui mixe le morceau final à notre place. En soit c'est cool, et ça marche plutôt pas mal, mais quelques options pour garder une certaine maitrise, même minime, du morceau de A à Z auraient été appréciables. Des options plus complexes dans la partie création, une ligne d'écriture plus longue (en tout cas en avoir la possibilité) donneraient un vrai plus également, il me semble.
Alors pourquoi un avis positif malgré tout? Tout simplement : le jeu reste diablement cool, et extrêmement addictif. C'est simple : on aura toujours envie d'y retourner un peu pour retrouver cette ambiance sous acide et pour le plaisir de mettre en forme un petit morceau, d'essayer de nouvelles combinaisons... Et là-dessus, il faut bien admettre qu'ils ont réussis leur coup.

Le jeu est encore en accès anticipé, donc on ne sait jamais, tout cela peut encore s'améliorer. Dans tous les cas je suis tombé sous le charme.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997056687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1407188761}
review: Està bien para pasar un rato, al principio mola su rollo Dafk Punk, pero enseguida se hace repetitivo y no tiene casi alicientes. Se termina en menos de hora y media. Lo adquirí en un Bundle por 1€, por ese precio está bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999565021', 'num_games_owned': 4436, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1407210421}
review: Est ce réellement un jeu ou un logiciel vous permettant de d'écouvrir le fabuleux monde du sampling ? je pencherai plus pour la deuxième option, puisqu'il est presque impossible de raté un morceau, et que Cosmic DJ vous propose clef en main des beats pret à l'emploi. L'exportation de vos creations peut etre sympas, mais de là à créer le tube de demain j'en doute fort.  Peut etre certains d'entre vous auront l'envie de faire un tour sur les logiciels pro de samples ou de djing pour mixer ou composer leur propre beat. Bien entendu Cosmic DJ s'adresse avant tout aux fans d'electro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077342913', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1586727754}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056119445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1449441088}
review:
Erst eine Stunde gespielt und schon bin ich überzeugt von dem Spiel.
Es hat nämlich einen guten Punkt: Es macht irre Spaß.

Durch geloopte Abfolgen von Instrumenttönen und deren Kombination mit der Hintergrundmusik
entsteht in Cosmic DJ meist ein wundervolles Stück Musik.
Das Spiel selbst hat eine Kampagne, die ich jedoch nicht als solche bezeichnen würde, da man sie -wenn man sich nicht anstrengt- einfach schnell in 1-2 stunden durchspielen kann.
Gibt man sich jedoch viel Mühe für einen Track und steckt ein wenig Zeit hinein hat man meist viel mehr Spaß, denn darum geht es in dem Spiel vor allem.
Warum ich das sage? - Nun ja, für gewöhnlich fesseln mich Spiele, weil ich das Ende der Story erreichen möchte und den Drang habe, alles zu vervollständigen. Hier fesselt mich vor allem der Spaß am herumbasteln und nicht die Story selbst.

Jedoch ist durch die wenn auch etwas 'trockene' Story und die zahlreichen unterschiedlichen Musikmittel sowie Farben und Bewegungen sehr viel Abwechslung und vor allem Spaß geboten.
Klare Kaufempfehlung, vor allem für den Preis!


10/10 Und das in einem Early Access-Spiel

author: {'steamid': '76561198068224715', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1407171841}
review:
Cosmic DJ is a musical game, much like Audiosurf and Symphony, but this time, you make your OWN music using a sequencer or what I like to call the "tap cymbals". You can switch and use them interchangably at any time. Unlike Audiosurf and Symphony, however, you cannot USE your own music for gameplay, as this is a creation game.

There's a tiny bit of storyline to this game. Basically, some cosmic cube is in charge of jamming out the cosmos and he decided to teach you how to jam out with him and make your own music. But, while you're hosting this rad party, some other dude comes in and starts to rudely broadcast his music instead. The controls are easy as well as the difficulty, as even my dog could probably make good music by stepping all over my keyboard. As for the audio, it's basically the entire game and it's awesome. The graphics are pretty stellar, too.

My experience with Cosmic DJ was awesome. Shortlived, but awesome. At first, it seemed like a stupid game that should just be on the mobile store and that's all there was to it. But, as I played, it turned out to be easy to control with the mouse and ZXCV keys. I personally thought it was very cute. The sequencer was used--as I found out--for more accurate tunes whereas the Tap Cymbals were more for "Press random keys and hope for the best" kind of deal. I actually really wanted to see how far the story went, so I decided to finish it in one runthrough. It took me exactly 58 minutes to finish, which was disappointing, but then I remembered seeing the "Quick Play" Option in the menu and
tried that out for a while, which was not disappointing.

From the realistic puppet bros to the assembling of a jetpack corgi, Cosmic DJ was a great game. Although early access, it still was complete with no bugs that I saw my entire runthrough and the game is basically finished. Though there's music programs out there that can do the same thing Cosmic DJ can do, if you can't sequence or even put together a great track with something like Fruity Loops Studio, Cosmic DJ will take the random input you put in the Sequencer or the Tap Cymbals and make it sound like magic. 

What I would've liked to have seen, however, was a bit more storyline gameplay. But, for $6 and running on Unity, this game is amazing. The only trouble I potentially had with it was if I was running something in the background, the dialogue audio by that Cosmic Cube would skip a little bit. It wasn't really much of a pain as you'd think, so don't let that stop you from checking this game out.

I would reccommend this to just about anyone. It's a great game and definitely is worth the $6 I paid for it. If you were on the fence about buying this game previously, just do it and don't look back. It's not as bad as you'd expect. Plus, with that hilarious trailer, why wouldn't you?

author: {'steamid': '76561198038894441', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1494451510}
review:
This game is really, really good. If you like music, and you love electronic music especially.. I found this game AMAZING.

If you have no talent mixing music IRL then no problemo you can still have fun! Theres some really awesome visuals and the music YOU create is only half the jam. If you do know how to create music you can actually get a lot of inspiration. If you are stuck creating new tracks pick up this game. You can actually if you pay attention to the beat and chords make some decent music. Also a tip. You can adjust the instruments sound levels by clicking the "gear" icon so that your bass doesn't drown the drums or whatever. 

you can also find this on humble bundle for a decent price although what you pay here is still worth the price. I have payed more for games that are only half as good as this one, and its not even done, who knows what the future will bring to this game.

9/10 


cons:
Story could be longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975900611', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1406967203}
review:
TL;DR: If you're looking for a fun, quick, casual music "game" it's worth it.  If you're looking for a more serious music game or sequencer, move along for now.

Basically, you're given the option of a Story Mode or Quickplay.

Story Mode: You're taken on a short journey in a futuristic cyberworld thats sweet jams have been taken over by a buzzkill.  Your quest is to repair 5 "Jamtennas" in order to bring bands and groups of people (and one puppy) back together, then take the city back.  Each Jamtenna consists of 4 or 5 segments that tell a story, and each segment forms a different part of the song.  Each part of the song gives you 4 or 5 different instruments, a background track, and a 2-bar loop to program in.  Each instrument gives you 4 different pitches (or sounds depending on the instrument).  Once the Jamtenna has been repaired, the game then crafts your segments into one sweet song and gives you the option to export to MP3.

Quick Play: You're randomly given 4 or 5 different instruments and a shuffle button to swap all of the instruments (there is currently no way to manually select the instruments, or the hold onto the ones you don't want to shuffle in).  You're then given a background track selected at random, and are allowed to go to town on it.  I haven't spent much time with this feature yet.

All in all, it's currently a super basic music sequencer with a cute story attached to it.  If you only do one playthrough, you could probably beat it in about 1 or 2 hours, and other than the patterns you throw down, you can't really deviate from what you're given (in terms of notes and instruments).

As far as I can tell from reading the discussion, there's a lot more coming with this game as the developer works on it.  MTCS is a pretty solid guy - he's very active in the discussion boards and listening to what we all have to say.

As stated in the tl;dr: If you're looking for a fun, quick, casual music "game" it's worth it.  If you're looking for a more serious music game or sequencer, move along for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098467416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1406952608}
review:
I found this game to be really fun. Kind of reminded me of if the Toonami guy had a run in with the Mooninites from Aqua Teens. 

This game is basically a sequencer with animations of corgis and a plot. You sequence your instruments one by one, then the games mixes it for you in to an exportable track when you're finished playing around. The game puts a strong emphasis on experimenting, with zero emphasis on actually keeping up with a rhythm. You can't lose at all.

There's no challenge factor here - just a fun factor. And it's short. Took me about an hour and a half to get through all the levels.

Is it worth the $5.99? Possibly, especially if you enjoy electronic dance music, puppets, corgis, and cheeseburgers. But if you're looking for a rhythm game,  something more akin to DJ HERO or Beatmania, then this isn't the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058230663', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1406944651}
review:
There is a certain charm from simulation games which allows anyone, even the ones who haven’t attended any music classes, to easily create their own content. You bring home a sense of accomplishment you don’t often find in other games. Cosmic DJ is one good example of this type of game.

You are the cosmic DJ

You, a floating no face protagonist, are deemed the cosmic DJ by STEVE3, the cosmic conductor of the universe. After learning how to create your own beats and making everyone in the party rock to your groove, STEVE4 crashes the city with bad vibes. It is now up to you to fix the jamtennas with some sweet tracks. 

Gameplay

Calling Cosmic DJ a game may not be entirely appropriate. This isn’t like dance revolution or guitar hero where you need to correctly follow a certain QTE like sequence in order to play the tracks correctly. There are also no game overs or consequence to be had here (except for some ear damaging music). 

In Cosmic DJ, you play out a scene which is separated into four parts. You select which instruments to play during these parts. You are then presented with a sequencer to input the notes of the instruments. Once you filled in enough notes (regardless of sequence), you are given the option of adding a new instrument to play during a part of the scene. In order to advance to the next part of the scene, you need to fill the “joy” bar by adding enough notes to play the instruments. 

Once you finish a scene, you can save the track you created as an MP3 file. While the game encodes the track, you can create the cover art which will be attached to the file you are creating. The game allows you to save your MP3 in any folder in your hard drive.

Presentation
The art style of the game is something straight out of the 80s. From the neon colours to the 3D pixel characters, everything fits the theme of Cosmic DJ. When an instrument plays, you get a visual cue of it playing at the top part of the screen.

My thoughts
One major flaw of Cosmic DJ is its limitation of options in creating your own music track. You create about 60% of the music track where the notes you inserted plays along with the main sequence of the track. There aren’t any other options to help you customise your music to your liking such as controlling the tempo. Since this is just an early access game, gl33k might add more options and sequences for the full retail version.
 
After creating three tracks, I thought anyone can just mash buttons in order to create a decent track. Turns out this isn’t the case.
Here is one of the good ones I made:
 
http://picosong.com/c5eX/

Here is the intended bad one (decrease your volume. You have been warned)

http://picosong.com/c5eF/

Overall, this is one worthwhile game to add to your library. There is nothing like showing off an mp3 to people you know and say you made this yourself with Cosmic DJ.  

http://gwiser.kinja.com/the-cosmic-power-of-your-own-music-1614624880?rev=1406940712605

author: {'steamid': '76561198003874143', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1420829606}
review:
Not really a game so much as it is a musical experience, I can see this working as an entry-level music composition tool meant less for creating personal, quality tunes and more for simply becoming familiar with the act of creating music.

Cosmic DJ functions as something of a simple music sequencer, with separate options for each "course" you choose. "Course," in this case, being a series of scenarios that the game's "story" lays out. The narrative of the game consists of you, the Cosmic DJ, repairing "Jamtennas" so that the galaxy can be filled with good vibes again. It's actually pretty great to see the game almost lampoon its own culture--the visuals are psychadelic, the audio consists of the EDM music you help construct (much of the base track has already been laid out for you), and it generally feels like a fun, at times silly process to create these songs.

My favorite part of Cosmic DJ is the way it mixes the song portions you create into an MP3 track that is ready to play instantly. While these tracks aren't really all that long, it's still fun to go over your creations and try to outdo yourself. And who knows, maybe this game will get you into buying more expensive but more robust software with which to create and mix your own songs. I kind of wish this game would allow for something on that level, but if that were the case then it probably wouldn't be selling for $6.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110708863', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1461962845}
review:
I played the game for a little while and could only enthusiastically imagine the world of endless possibilities which it opens. I would even go as far as to say it has the potential of becoming a pillar of music related genres in video gaming.
That being said it has a very long (and dangerous  - bwahaha) journey to make until that will be accomplished; it's all in the hands of the developers and how they are willing to commit!

My suggestion is that they should expand it to many more music types -> samples -> instruments. Their prototype is working fine overall, some tweaking of the "game mechanics" is still required and they definitely need to have more game content.
I have very high hopes for the finished product and highly recommend you try it out even as early access!

/whisper
'Humble Bundle'
[flies away]

author: {'steamid': '76561198040846663', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1409964335}
review:
Early access and already awesome.

There are not many music-related games out there that allow you to create something.
In most of them, you create the patterns others will have to follow on a certain music.

Here, it is just you, the music, and your imagination.

Well of course it's not a creation tool with whom you will become the next Madeon xD but it is indeed fun to play with, because it is simple, and the sounds are so that whatever pattern will sound cool with it.

So, yeah, recommended if you want to have fun with music and create something without having to learn a bunch of complicated things.

Still in development, so don't expect a bug-free game. It is stable, as far as I am concerned, but some inputs are sometimes a bit slow to react. Hope it gets lots of updates and new content ! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198083977106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1406831962}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978902089', 'num_games_owned': 8122, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1406762664}
review: For the price, this is a genuinely nice game. Play value? Not so much, sadly. I watched the trailer and it was very hyped up - more than it intends. So unless you are into this sort of thing; of somewhat limited sequencing and having a creative mind but lacking proper music creation skills, this is definitely for you. Personally I just find it far too limiting and repetitive. You press a block, it plays a note - you press more blocks, it plays more notes. Again, for the price, extremely worth it. But for play value, you will get bored in no more than 30 minutes if you aren't into simplicity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017746934', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1405178834}
review:
10/10 Would jam again!

Game is basically a sweet step sequencer with a realtime tapping input option. You sequence music notes on a grid or tap them out as the background plays. The end result should be a sweet jam! It's simplistic but it mixes the end result nicely and is a lot of fun to play with. The game comes with a nice variety of short stab samples that you can sequence and play with. All in all, if you enjoy music games or if you're interested in electronic music composition, give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992801270', 'num_games_owned': 3941, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1420336147}
review: This is a strange, strange "game" but I enjoyed it immensely even in it's early alpha format.  The sequencer mechanic is simple but still allows for a ton of personal variation, the combinations of sounds sometimes sound a bit disparate, but tend to work well together and the fact that there is any attempt at a "story", yet still pulls it off is impressive.  The "remix" at the end can be a bit boring since they tend to all sound the same, but hopefully it'll will expand and add some variation as it matures.  At the full price of $6, it's well worth the money if you like music games or just want something to mess with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970487939', 'num_games_owned': 1791, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1451011892}
review:
for the price? This game is Jamazing, its fun and plain creative, The story is simple yet short, you play as the Cosmic DJ to help the Cosmic conductor to bring animals and people together while stopping the wild bad vibes of steve4 with the power of MUZIK!

the goal of the game gives you a grid and synthizer, it is limited but plans for this game to organize your own arrangements and creativity is coming

+ Sick beats
+ The music you produce is limited but you can always get something great going
+ The story is fun
+ The graphics are wierd, wild, yet fits the game very well.
+ The grid and synth is spot on with what you press
+ You can save your beats and what you made.
+ The sale value is worth it. You'll be having catchy beats all day in your head from this game
+ Devs says future plans in the work to extend the game + give you customization

- Limited in what you can do with the synth grid, no custom arrangements
- Needs more! instruments.
- short story
- The jam meter isn't really that great, it'll take any notes you make and say that you got it, as long as you got a knack for music
- you need a knack for music, otherwise you are bad vibes

review:
So i love this kind of absurdistic humor they have going on here. It's all over the top and abstract. But they have really made it easy for themselves regarding the "music making process". All songs sound almost the same. Are in the same beat and key even.
What changes is the instruments. And all my "jams" as it's called, have very similar melodies.

I hope the developers will be creating a much more advanced music making system. I enjoyed the story, but what we are really after here is our tunes being in the actual game i feel. It is a type of DJ game after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025412113', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1404328153}
review:
Langweilig - Ich liebe Musikspiele, gerne auch durchgeknallt, aber das hier hat gähnend langweilige Spielmechanik und war nach 111 Minuten durchgespielt.
Man bekommt einen Gridsequenzer und kann damit eigene "Songs" machen. Es gibt eine Fortschrittsleiste die ansteigt mit der Menge der Noten und wenn sie voll ist, kommt man zum nächsten Song, den man machen darf. Das passiert ein paar Mal - begleitet mit einer unterhaltsamen Story. Doch ist diese Story jedes Mal gleich gestrickt.
Das war das Spiel.
Könnte man mehr daraus machen. Wird hoffentlich auch noch mehr daraus gemacht.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990600165', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1404339426}
review:
Дюже странная вещица неопределённой жанровой принадлежности.

Формально, тут и сюжет есть, о том, как одна зловредная сущность испортила всем праздник, и мы теперь должны всё исправить путём сотворения музыки в духе Daft Punk. Суть сего сотворения такова: знай себе рандомно долби по кнопкам, в то время как на бэкграунде творится дичайшая психоделика. Проиграть невозможно. Какая бы лютая какофония не выходила, игра уверена, что ты замутил крутейший джем. Из этого вытекает первая серьёзная проблема: это вообще сложно назвать игрой.

Вторая же в том, что проходится здешний куцый сюжет менее, чем за час, что вкупе с однообразным (да и вообще чисто номинальным) геймплеем поднимает вопрос о то, что такая развлекалочка своих денег, вообще говоря, не стоит.

Тем не менее, определённую долю фана словить можно, особенно, если ты любитель электронной музыки и безумных визуальных решений. Что тут могут словить потребители за пределами ЦА, сказать затрудняюсь.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025482261', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1479648281}
review:
Une vraie surprise, c'est en fait un jeu de musique, sans vraiment être un jeu.
Vous disposez d'une grille de 4 notes par instruments sur deux mesures, et vous devez composer sur le tas par dessus un fond musical.
L'outil est limité, mais ça permet d'avoir du fun immédiat.

Car il y a une histoire ! Vous devez mixer pour sauver le cosmos (rien que ça).
Rétablissez les différentes jamtènes grâce au POUVOIR DE LA MUSIQUE ! Changez d'instrument à la volée et envoyez la sauce.
Lorsque vous avez fini de rétablir une jamtène, le jeu vous fait un petit remix de vos compositions, que vous aurez droit de télécharger pour écouter n'importe où. Vous pouvez même créer votre jaquette durant la génération du mix.

En gros, un petit délire spontané plutôt réussi, et qui vaut son prix.
N'espérez pas y jouer plus d'une semaine, ça reste du plaisir instantané ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050034791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1404393841}
review: 100% recommending this game to everyone. It may still be in Early Access, but I'm genuinely blown away at how creative it is. I bought it on a whim, and was just expecting it to be a rhythm/sound-based video game (like Beat Hazard, for example,) only for it to turn out to be an INTERACTIVE SOUNDLAB. I'm a sucker for things like that, especally as I played Fluid back in the day, but Fluid ain't got shit on this. This is incredible. I'm in love with this game and I can't wait to see what else they do with it before publishing it as a full game (i.e not Early Access.) Gl33k, job well done on this. I literally can't fault it so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008400838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1401613948}
review:
En temps normal je suis plutôt bon public pour les jeux musicaux. (surtout avec une pointe de wtf) 
J'aurais aimé adhérer à celui-ci... force est de constater que la sauce n'a pas prit sur moi hélas. 
L'aspect visuel volontairement barré colle très bien au soft. Du moins ce n'est pas sur ce point que je bloque. 
En revanche, la bande son (les samples en l'occurrence) s'avère vite limitée ce qui rend le jeu relativement rébarbatif.  
On a beau essayer de varier les rythmes et les mélodies, mais avec seulement quelques nuances de sons par instrument , on épuise vite tout le registre. 
L'autre point noir du soft, c'est qu'il se permet de mixer vos morceaux à votre place.
Du coup on a le sentiment de ne pas maitriser grand chose au final vu que la compo se fait toute seule. 
Bref, un soft qui mériterait plus de contenu et de possibilités. 
À surveiller du coin de l'œil... ou pas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986448970', 'num_games_owned': 8182, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1415124470}
review:
I uploaded a video of some starter gameplay for you to check out. Enjoy. :)
http://youtu.be/oZORo_I03rM

Cosmic DJ is game where you create and play using music beats much like on a beat pad app or similar grid sequence music software.
This is a game that if you enjoy making music and having a good time then you will love this. But don't think you will be making professional music. This is really to just have fun and enjoy the game experience and the trippy graphics. Also, the game narrator rocks! He is the best part of the game.

The game is really about making your own music through beat pade and a grid sequencer using their beats and tunes which they give you a good selection to choose from. But it's up to you how you mix it up. :)
But what I really like is that you can save your tunes as an MP3 file on your PC to show off and listen to later on. That's awesome.
Overall, for the price, this is a good game experience to try out. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072174644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1442852366}
review: Dont Buy waste of money and still plays the same in Early Access

author: {'steamid': '76561198005465099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1561059269}
review:
First of all, if anyone is afraid of the "Early Acess" mark, then don't fret, because the game is basically finished, and I have not experienced any bugs or the like. 

So what in the rationality of the cosmos is this?
This is basically a simplified version of a music program turned into a semi-game. It's not really a game, but it's not really a creative software. This might sound bad on paper, but the execution is done surprisingly well.

So what do we do in this game?
You enter a level and you get 5-6 different instruments which you can use to make some qoute-unqoute "Sweet Jams". Each instruments have four notes or sounds (depending if it is a melodic instrument or percussions or something). Here you can either choose to put it in a grid or you can map them to the computer keyboard to play the instruments live. You have 8 tacts that loop to fill out, each split into 4 different quarter tacts, totalling a total of 32 places to place the sound. So with 5 instruments, 4 notes, and 32 places to play, you can make a total of 640 different versions per song... kinda. The song you make is in actuality just a part of the song, and you need to make 4 parts of the song in total, making the total of different versions totalling 2560. 
After making a song, the game will mix it and make a minute and twenty seconds long single out of it, and you will get the option to make an album cover of said single.

How many songs are there?
5,5-ish. I know that's a silly answer, but it will make sense when you play.

Is it fun?
YES! Yes, it is, although I can't shake the feeling that there really is no way to make a bad song, unless you're actually trying to. You don't actually make the song totally from scratch. There is always some background music, which is basically the same for every song, as it turns out, and then you map out the five instruments and they kind of drown out in each other a bit, so it's actually hard to hear if what you've made is a substantial piece. 
But honestly, that doesn't matter. You're really not supposed to feel good about the songs afterwards, this is a game, where you will be having a blast WHILE MAKING the song. Yeah, afterwards the song may not be that good in hinsight, but goddamnit you were grooving the hell out when mixing it.
Also the option to either use the grid sequenser or the tabs is a good choice. The more somber perfectionistic type will probably be loving the grid, while the more bombastic person, who may or may not play live instruments, will probably like to groove out with the tabs.
It also helps that the more instruments and the more music you put into your jams, the wilder the background music gets.
As a game, there is no real way of losing, and it is not really challenging at all, but the game is not about that.

Uhmm... this is probably a stupid question, but is there a story?
Surprisingly, yes. You are the Cosmic DJ, and you send groovy jams and good vibes throughout all of the galaxies, but the annoying STEVE4 is sending bad vibes, and you must stop him. It is an incredibly non-sensical story, filled with humor and it doesn't warrant to be taken seriously.

Is the price fair?
Hmm... yeah, I think so. The main game is only an hour and half long, but there is a lot of replay value picking the "Quickplay" menu, and then just make a neat little groove every now and then. 6€ (or whatever it is in dollars or pounds) is not much and you will have fun with the game every now and then.

This game is approved.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960289251', 'num_games_owned': 1361, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1404424593}
review:
So what is Cosmic DJ? I've played a bit and it's a Music Sequencer game with crazy background story and graphics.

Ok, i'm only 20 mins, I don't think it's possible to lose, you basically use a sequencer at the bottom of the screen to create jams.  These eventually quality you to "Submit the Jam", once you submit enough you can create an single of your music..

A fun distraction maybe, not very serious for sure. So if you like Music games with crazy graphics you should like this..

I "completed" the story side within 90 mins, it really is a fun distraction music sequencer game. Sort of game you might fire up if you've got 10 mins spare,  experiment with music a bit, create a tune.
